comments are being modified\n     * @param tourist The tourist who is modifying comments\n     */\n    public CommentModificationService(Site site, Tourist tourist) {\n        if (site == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Site cannot be null");\n        }\n        if (tourist == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Tourist cannot be null");\n        }\n        \n        this.site = site;\n        this.tourist = tourist;\n        this.isConnectedToServer = true; // Assume connected initially\n        this.scanner = new Scanner(System.in);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main method to execute the comment modification process.\n     * This method orchestrates the entire flow of the use case.\n     * \n     * @return true if comment was successfully modified, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean executeModifyCommentFlow() {\n        System.out.println("=== Modify Comment Process ===");\n        System.out.println("Site: " + site.getName());\n        System.out.println("Tourist: " + tourist.getFullName());\n        \n        // Check connection to server ETOUR\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 1: Choose to change comment on feedback\n        Comment commentToModify = selectCommentToModify();\n        if (commentToModify == null) {\n            System.out.println("No comment selected for modification.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 2: Verify data entered and ask for confirmation\n        String newContent = getNewCommentContent();\n        if (!validateNewContent(newContent)) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Invalid comment content provided.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Ask for confirmation\n        if (!askForConfirmation(commentToModify, newContent)) {\n            System.out.println("Comment modification cancelled by user.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 3: Confirm change (implied by user confirmation)\n        // Step 4: Edit commentary on selected feedback\n        boolean modificationSuccessful = performCommentModification(commentToModify, newContent);\n        \n        // Exit: System shall notify alterations\n        if (modificationSuccessful) {\n            notifyAlterations(commentToModify);\n        }\n        \n        return modificationSuccessful;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Selects a comment to modify from the tourist\'s comments on this site.\n     * This implements Step 1 of the use case flow.\n     * \n     * @return The selected comment to modify, or null if no valid selection\n     */\n    private Comment selectCommentToModify() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 1: Select Comment to Modify ---");\n        \n        // Get all comments by this tourist on this site\n        var touristComments = site.getCommentsByTourist(tourist.getId());\n        \n        if (touristComments.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("You have no comments on this site to modify.");\n            return null;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("Your comments on this site:");\n        for (int i = 0; i < touristComments.size(); i++) {\n            Comment comment = touristComments.get(i);\n            System.out.printf("%d. [%s] %s%n", \n                i + 1, \n                comment.getCreatedAt().toString(), \n                comment.getContent().length() > 50 ? \n                    comment.getContent().substring(0, 47) + "..." : \n                    comment.getContent());\n        }\n        \n        System.out.print("\\nEnter the number of the comment you want to modify (or 0 to cancel): ");\n        \n        try {\n            int choice = Integer.parseInt(scanner.nextLine().trim());\n            \n            if (choice == 0) {\n                System.out.println("Operation cancelled.");\n                return null;\n            }\n            \n            if (choice < 1 || choice > touristComments.size()) {\n                System.out.println("Invalid selection. Please enter a number between 1 and " + touristComments.size());\n                return null;\n            }\n            \n            Comment selectedComment = touristComments.get(choice - 1);\n            System.out.println("Selected comment: " + selectedComment.getContent());\n            return selectedComment;\n            \n        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n            System.out.println("Invalid input. Please enter a valid number.");\n            return null;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets new comment content from the user.\n     * This is part of Step 2 of the use case flow.\n     * \n     * @return The new comment content entered by the user\n     */\n    private String getNewCommentContent() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 2: Enter New Comment Content ---");\n        System.out.println("Please enter the new content for your comment:");\n        System.out.print("> ");\n        \n        return scanner.nextLine().trim();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates the new comment content.\n     * This implements the validation part of Step 2 of the use case flow.\n     * If data is invalid, the system should activate the error case.\n     * \n     * @param newContent The new comment content to validate\n     * @return true if content is valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean validateNewContent(String newContent) {\n        if (newContent == null || newContent.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Comment content cannot be empty.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (newContent.length() < 5) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Comment must be at least 5 characters long.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (newContent.length() > 1000) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Comment cannot exceed 1000 characters.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check for inappropriate content (basic example)\n        String[] inappropriateWords = {"spam", "advertisement", "offensive"};\n        String lowerContent = newContent.toLowerCase();\n        for (String word : inappropriateWords) {\n            if (lowerContent.contains(word)) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Comment contains inappropriate content.");\n                return false;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Asks the user for confirmation before modifying the comment.\n     * This implements the confirmation part of Step 2 of the use case flow.\n     * \n     * @param comment The comment to be modified\n     * @param newContent The new content for the comment\n     * @return true if user confirms, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean askForConfirmation(Comment comment, String newContent) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Confirm Modification ---");\n        System.out.println("Original comment: " + comment.getContent());\n        System.out.println("New comment: " + newContent);\n        System.out.println("\\nAre you sure you want to modify this comment? (yes/no)");\n        System.out.print("> ");\n        \n        String response = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n        return response.equals("yes") || response.equals("y");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Performs the actual comment modification.\n     * This implements Step 4 of the use case flow.\n     * \n     * @param comment The comment to modify\n     * @param newContent The new content for the comment\n     * @return true if modification was successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean performCommentModification(Comment comment, String newContent) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 4: Modifying Comment ---");\n        \n        // Check server connection again before modification\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection lost during modification process.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            // Check if tourist has permission to modify this comment\n            if (!tourist.canModifyComment(comment)) {\n                System.out.println("Error: You do not have permission to modify this comment.");\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            // Perform the modification\n            boolean success = comment.modifyContent(newContent);\n            \n            if (success) {\n                System.out.println("Comment successfully modified.");\n                return true;\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Comment was not modified (content unchanged).");\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error during modification: " + e.getMessage());\n            return false;\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            System.out.println("Unexpected error during modification: " + e.getMessage());\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Notifies the user about the alterations made to the comment.\n     * This implements the exit condition of the use case.\n     * \n     * @param modifiedComment The comment that was modified\n     */\n    private void notifyAlterations(Comment modifiedComment) {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Notification of Alterations ===");\n        System.out.println("Your comment has been successfully updated.");\n        System.out.println("Comment ID: " + modifiedComment.getId());\n        System.out.println("Modified at: " + modifiedComment.getModifiedAt());\n        System.out.println("New content: " + modifiedComment.getContent());\n        System.out.println("====================================\\n");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks the connection to the server ETOUR.\n     * This handles the interruption condition mentioned in the use case.\n     * \n     * @return true if connected to server, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean checkServerConnection() {\n        // In a real implementation, this would check actual server connectivity\n        // For this simulation, we\'ll use a simple flag that can be toggled\n        return isConnectedToServer;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates a server connection interruption.\n     * This method can be used to test the interruption handling.\n     */\n    public void simulateServerDisconnection() {\n        this.isConnectedToServer = false;\n        System.out.println("Simulated server disconnection.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Re-establishes server connection.\n     */\n    public void reconnectToServer() {\n        this.isConnectedToServer = true;\n        System.out.println("Reconnected to server.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the current server connection status.\n     * \n     * @return true if connected to server, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean isConnectedToServer() {\n        return isConnectedToServer;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Closes the scanner resource.\n     * This should be called when the service is no longer needed.\n     */\n    public void close() {\n        if (scanner != null) {\n            scanner.close();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Alternative method for modifying a comment without interactive prompts.\n     * This can be used for programmatic comment modification.\n     * \n     * @param commentId The ID of the comment to modify\n     * @param newContent The new content for the comment\n     * @param requireConfirmation Whether to require confirmation (simulated)\n     * @return true if modification was successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean modifyComment(String commentId, String newContent, boolean requireConfirmation) {\n        // Check server connection\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Get the comment\n        Comment comment = site.getComment(commentId);\n        if (comment == null) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Comment not found.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check permissions\n        if (!tourist.canModifyComment(comment)) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Tourist does not have permission to modify this comment.");\n            return false;\n a real implementation, this would involve user interaction\n        }\n        \n        // Perform modification\n        boolean success = comment.modifyContent(newContent);\n        \n        // encapsulates all the attributes of a comment and provides\n * methods for modification while maintaining data integrity.\n */\npublic class Comment {\n    private final String id;           // Unique identifier for the comment\n    private String content;           // The actual comment text\n    private final String authorId;     // ID of the tourist who wrote the comment\n    private final String siteId;       // ID of the site this comment belongs to\n    private LocalDateTime createdAt;  // When the comment was originally created\n    private LocalDateTime modifiedAt; // When the comment was last modified\n    private boolean isModified;       // Flag to track if comment has been modified\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor for creating a new comment.\n     * \n     * @param id Unique identifier for the comment\n     * @param content The comment text\n     * @param authorId ID of the tourist who wrote the comment\n     * @param siteId ID of the site this comment belongs to\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if any required parameter is null or empty\n     */\n    public Comment(String id, String content, String authorId, String siteId) {\n        validateParameters(id, content, authorId, siteId);\n        \n        this.id = id;\n        this.content = content;\n        this.authorId = authorId;\n        this.siteId = siteId;\n        this.createdAt = LocalDateTime.now();\n        this.modifiedAt = this.createdAt;\n        this.isModified = false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates constructor parameters to ensure data integrity.\n     * \n     * @param id Comment ID\n     * @param content Comment content\n     * @param authorId Author ID\n     * @param siteId Site ID\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if any parameter is invalid\n     */\n    private void validateParameters(String id, String content, String authorId, String siteId) {\n        if (id == null || id.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Comment ID cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n        if (content == null || content.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Comment content cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n        if (authorId == null || authorId.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Author ID cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n        if (siteId == null || siteId.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Site ID cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Modifies the comment content with validation.\n     * This method implements the core functionality of the ModifyComment use case.\n     * \n     * @param newContent The new content for the comment\n     * @return true if modification was successful, false otherwise\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if new content is invalid\n     */\n    public boolean modifyContent(String newContent) {\n        // Validate the new content\n        if (newContent == null || newContent.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("New comment content cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n        \n        // Check if content is actually changing\n        if (this.content.equals(newContent)) {\n            return false; // No change needed\n        }\n        \n        // Update the content and modification metadata\n        this.content = newContent;\n        this.modifiedAt = LocalDateTime.now();\n        this.isModified = true;\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the current content of the comment.\n     * \n     * @return The comment content\n     */\n    public String getContent() {\n        return content;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the unique identifier of the comment.\n     * \n     * @return Comment ID\n     */\n    public String getId() {\n        return id;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the ID of the tourist who wrote the comment.\n     * \n     * @return Author ID\n     */\n    public String getAuthorId() {\n        return authorId;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the ID of the site this comment belongs to.\n     *      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Site description cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Adds a comment to the site.\n     * This method is called when a tourist Choose to change comment on feedback\n * 2. Verify data entered and ask for confirmation; if invalid, activate error case\n * 3. Confirm change\n * 4. Edit commentary on selected feedback\n * 5. Notify alterations\n * \n * The service also handles connection interruptions to server ETOUR.\n */\npublic class CommentModificationService {\n    private final Site site;\n    private final Tourist tourist;\n    private boolean isConnectedToServer;\n    private final Scanner scanner;\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor for CommentModificationService.\n     * \n     * @param site The site where comments are being modified\n     * @param tourist The tourist who is modifying comments\n     */\n    public CommentModificationService(Site site, Tourist tourist) {\n        if (site == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Site cannot be null");\n        }\n        if (tourist == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Tourist cannot be null");\n        }\n        \n        this.site = site;\n        this.tourist = tourist;\n        this.isConnectedToServer = true; // Assume connected initially\n        this.scanner = new Scanner(System.in);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main method to execute the comment modification process.\n     * This method orchestrates the entire flow of the use case.\n     * \n     * @return true if comment was successfully modified, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean executeModifyCommentFlow() {\n        System.out.println("=== Modify Comment Process ===");\n        System.out.println("Site: " + site.getName());\n        System.out.println("Tourist: " + tourist.getFullName());\n        \n        // Check connection to server ETOUR\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 1: Choose to change comment on feedback\n        Comment commentToModify = selectCommentToModify();\n        if (commentToModify == null) {\n            System.out.println("No comment selected for modification.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 2: Verify data entered and ask for confirmation\n        String newContent = getNewCommentContent();\n        if (!validateNewContent(newContent)) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Invalid comment content provided.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Ask for confirmation\n        if (!askForConfirmation(commentToModify, newContent)) {\n            System.out.println("Comment modification cancelled by user.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 3: Confirm change (implied by user confirmation)\n        // Step 4: Edit commentary on selected feedback\n        boolean modificationSuccessful = performCommentModification(commentToModify, newContent);\n        \n        // Exit: System shall notify alterations\n        if (modificationSuccessful) {\n            notifyAlterations(commentToModify);\n        }\n        \n        return modificationSuccessful;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Selects a comment to modify from the tourist\'s comments on this site.\n     * This implements Step 1 of the use case flow.\n     * \n     * @return The selected comment to modify, or null if no valid selection\n     */\n    private Comment selectCommentToModify() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 1: Select Comment to Modify ---");\n        \n        // Get all comments by this tourist on this site\n        var touristComments = site.getCommentsByTourist(tourist.getId());\n        \n        if (touristComments.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("You have no comments on this site to modify.");\n            return null;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("Your comments on this site:");\n        for (int i = 0; i < touristComments.size(); i++) {\n            Comment comment = touristComments.get(i);\n            System.out.printf("%d. [%s] %s%n", \n                i + 1, \n                comment.getCreatedAt().toString(), \n                comment.getContent().length() > 50 ? \n                    comment.getContent().substring(0, 47) + "..." : \n                    comment.getContent());\n        }\n        \n        System.out.print("\\nEnter the number of the comment you want to modify (or 0 to cancel): ");\n        \n        try {\n            int choice = Integer.parseInt(scanner.nextLine().trim());\n            \n            if (choice == 0) {\n                System.out.println("Operation cancelled.");\n                return null;\n            }\n            \n            if (choice < 1 || choice > touristComments.size()) {\n                System.out.println("Invalid selection. Please enter a number between 1 and " + touristComments.size());\n                return null;\n            }\n            \n            Comment selectedComment = touristComments.get(choice - 1);\n            System.out.println("Selected comment: " + selectedComment.getContent());\n            return selectedComment;\n            \n        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n            System.out.println("Invalid input. Please enter a valid number.");\n            return null;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets new comment content from the user.\n     * This is part of Step 2 of the use case flow.\n     * \n     * @return The new comment content entered by the user\n     */\n    private String getNewCommentContent() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 2: Enter New Comment Content ---");\n        System.out.println("Please enter the new content for your comment:");\n        System.out.print("> ");\n        \n        return scanner.nextLine().trim();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates the new comment content.\n     * This implements the validation part of Step 2 of the use case flow.\n     * If data is invalid, the system should activate the error case.\n     * \n     * @param newContent The new comment content to validate\n     * @return true if content is valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean validateNewContent(String newContent) {\n        if (newContent == null || newContent.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Comment content cannot be empty.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (newContent.length() < 5) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Comment must be at least 5 characters long.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (newContent.length() > 1000) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Comment cannot exceed 1000 characters.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check for inappropriate content (basic example)\n        String[] inappropriateWords = {"spam", "advertisement", "offensive"};\n        String lowerContent = newContent.toLowerCase();\n        for (String word : inappropriateWords) {\n            if (lowerContent.contains(word)) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Comment contains inappropriate content.");\n                return false;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Asks the user for confirmation before modifying the comment.\n     * This implements the confirmation part of Step 2 of the use case flow.\n     * \n     * @param comment The comment to be modified\n     * @param newContent The new content for the comment\n     * @return true if user confirms, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean askForConfirmation(Comment comment, String newContent) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Confirm Modification ---");\n        System.out.println("Original comment: " + comment.getContent());\n        System.out.println("New comment: " + newContent);\n        System.out.println("\\nAre you sure you want to modify this comment? (yes/no)");\n        System.out.print("> ");\n        \n        String response = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n        return response.equals("yes") || response.equals("y");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Performs the actual comment modification.\n     * This implements Step 4 of the use case flow.\n     * \n     * @param comment The comment to modify\n     * @param newContent The new content for the comment\n     * @return true if modification was successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean performCommentModification(Comment comment, String newContent) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 4: Modifying Comment ---");\n        \n        // Check server connection again before modification\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection lost during modification process.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            // Check if tourist has permission to modify this comment\n            if (!tourist.canModifyComment(comment)) {\n                System.out.println("Error: You do not have permission to modify this comment.");\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            // Perform the modification\n            boolean success = comment.modifyContent(newContent);\n            \n            if (success) {\n                System.out.println("Comment successfully modified.");\n                return true;\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Comment was not modified (content unchanged).");\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error during modification: " + e.getMessage());\n            return false;\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            System.out.println("Unexpected error during modification: " + e.getMessage());\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Notifies the user about the alterations made to the comment.\n     * This implements the exit condition of the use case.\n     * \n     * @param modifiedComment The comment that was modified\n     */\n    private void notifyAlterations(Comment modifiedComment) {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Notification of Alterations ===");\n        System.out.println("Your comment has been successfully updated.");\n        System.out.println("Comment ID: " + modifiedComment.getId());\n        System.out.println("Modified at: " + modifiedComment.getModifiedAt());\n        System.out.println("New content: " + modifiedComment.getContent());\n        System.out.println("====================================\\n");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks the connection to the server ETOUR.\n     * This handles the interruption condition mentioned in the use case.\n     * \n     * @return true if connected to server, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean checkServerConnection() {\n        // In a real implementation, this would check actual server connectivity\n        // For this simulation, we\'ll use a simple flag that can be toggled\n        return isConnectedToServer;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates a server connection interruption.\n     * This method can be used to test the interruption handling.\n     */\n    public void simulateServerDisconnection() {\n        this.isConnectedToServer = false;\n        System.out.println("Simulated server disconnection.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Re-establishes server connection.\n     */\n    public void reconnectToServer() {\n        this.isConnectedToServer = true;\n        System.out.println("Reconnected to server.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the current server connection status.\n     * \n     * @return true if connected to server, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean isConnectedToServer() {\n        return isConnectedToServer;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Closes the scanner resource.\n     * This should be called when the service is no longer needed.\n     */\n    public void close() {\n        if (scanner != null) {\n            scanner.close();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Alternative method for modifying a comment without interactive prompts.\n     * This can be used for programmatic comment modification.\n     * \n     * @param commentId The ID of the comment to modify\n     * @param newContent The new content for the comment\n     * @param requireConfirmation Whether to require confirmation (simulated)\n     * @return true if modification was successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean modifyComment(String commentId, String newContent, boolean requireConfirmation) {\n        // Check server connection\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Get the comment\n        Comment comment = site.getComment(commentId);\n        if (comment == null) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Comment not found.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check permissions\n        if (!tourist.canModifyComment(comment)) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Tourist does not have permission to modify this comment.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Validate new content\n        if (!validateNewContent(newContent)) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Invalid comment content.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Simulate confirmation if required\n        if (requireConfirmation) {\n            System.out.println("Simulating confirmation for comment modification...");\n            // In package com.etour.modifycomment;

/**
 * Main class for the ModifyComment application.
 * This class demonstrates the complete "ModifyComment" use case with sample data
 * and provides a console interface for user interaction.
 * 
 * The application simulates:
 * 1. A tourist viewing site details
 * 2. Selecting a comment to modify
 * 3. Entering new comment content
 * 4. Validating and confirming the change
 * 5. Executing the modification
 * 6. Notifying about alterations
 * 
 * It also handles the interruption scenario (connection to server ETOUR).
 */
public class Main {
    
    /**
     * Main entry point of the application.
     * 
     * @param args Command line arguments (not used)
     */
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        System.out.println("===============================================");
        System.out.println("       ETOUR - Modify Comment Application      ");
        System.out.println("===============================================\n");
        
        try {
            // Initialize the application with sample data
            ApplicationController controller = new ApplicationController();
            controller.runApplication();
            
        } catch (Exception e) {
            System.err.println("An unexpected error occurred: " + e.getMessage());
            e.printStackTrace();
            System.exit(1);
        }
    }
    
    /**
     * ApplicationController class that manages the overall application flow.
     * This inner class orchestrates the setup and execution of the ModifyComment use case.
     */
    private static class ApplicationController {
        private Site site;
        private Tourist tourist;
        private CommentModificationService service;
        
        /**
         * Runs the complete ModifyComment application.
         */
        public void runApplication() {
            try {
                // Step 1: Setup application with sample data
                System.out.println("Initializing application...");
                setupSampleData();
                
                // Step 2: Simulate tourist authentication
                System.out.println("\n=== Tourist Authentication ===");
                if (!authenticateTourist()) {
                    System.out.println("Authentication failed. Application cannot proceed.");
                    return;
                }
                
                // Step 3: Display site information
                displaySiteInformation();
                
                // Step 4: Run the ModifyComment use case
                runModifyCommentUseCase();
                
                // Step 5: Demonstrate error handling and edge cases
                demonstrateEdgeCases();
                
            } finally {
                // Step 6: Cleanup resources
                cleanup();
            }
        }
        
        /**
         * Sets up sample data for the demonstration.
         * Creates a sample site, tourist, and comments.
         */
        private void setupSampleData() {
            // Create sample tourist
            tourist = new Tourist("T001", "traveler123", "John Smith");
            System.out.println("Created tourist: " + tourist.getFullName() + " (ID: " + tourist.getId() + ")");
            
            // Create sample site
            site = new Site("S001", "Eiffel Tower", 
                    "Iconic iron tower on the Champ de Mars in Paris, France.");
            System.out.println("Created site: " + site.getName() + " (ID: " + site.getId() + ")");
            
            // Create sample comments for the tourist
            createSampleComments();
            
            // Create the comment modification service
            service = new CommentModificationService(site, tourist);
            System.out.println("Comment modification service initialized.");
        }
        
        /**
         * Creates sample comments for the demonstration.
         */
        private void createSampleComments() {
            // Create sample comments
            Comment comment1 = new Comment("C001", 
                    "This was an amazing experience! The view from the top was breathtaking.", 
                    tourist.getId(), site.getId());
            
            Comment comment2 = new Comment("C002", 
                    "The queues were very long, but it was worth the wait. Highly recommended!", 
                    tourist.getId(), site.getId());
            
            Comment comment3 = new Comment("C003", 
                    "Great historical site. The lighting at night is beautiful.", 
                    "T002", site.getId()); // Comment by another tourist
            
            // Add comments to site
            site.addComment(comment1);
            site.addComment(comment2);
            site.addComment(comment3);
            
            // Register comments with tourist
            tourist.addComment(comment1.getId());
            tourist.addComment(comment2.getId());
            
            System.out.println("Created " + site.getTotalComments() + " sample comments for the site.");
            
            // Display comment summary
            System.out.println("Tourist " + tourist.getFullName() + " has " + 
                    tourist.getCommentIds().size() + " comments on this site.");
        }
        
        /**
         * Simulates tourist authentication.
         * 
         * @return true if authentication successful, false otherwise
         */
        private boolean authenticateTourist() {
            // In a real application, this would involve proper authentication
            // For demonstration, we'll use a simple token
            String authToken = "VALID_TOKEN_T001";
            
            System.out.println("Authenticating tourist " + tourist.getUsername() + "...");
            boolean authenticated = tourist.authenticate(authToken);
            
            if (authenticated) {
                System.out.println("✓ Authentication successful!");
                return true;
            } else {
                System.out.println("✗ Authentication failed. Please check your credentials.");
                return false;
            }
        }
        
        /**
         * Displays site information to the tourist.
         */
        private void displaySiteInformation() {
            System.out.println("\n=== Site Details ===");
            System.out.println("Site: " + site.getName());
            System.out.println("Description: " + site.getDescription());
            System.out.println("Average Rating: " + site.getAverageRating() + "/5.0");
            System.out.println("Total Comments: " + site.getTotalComments());
            
            // Display tourist's comments on this site
            var touristComments = site.getCommentsByTourist(tourist.getId());
            if (!touristComments.isEmpty()) {
                System.out.println("\nYour comments on this site:");
                for (int i = 0; i < touristComments.size(); i++) {
                    Comment comment = touristComments.get(i);
                    System.out.println((i + 1) + ". [" + comment.getCreatedAt().toLocalDate() + 
                            "] " + comment.getContent());
                }
            }
        }
        
        /**
         * Runs the main ModifyComment use case.
         */
        private void runModifyCommentUseCase() {
            System.out.println("\n\n" + "=".repeat(50));
            System.out.println("   MODIFY COMMENT USE CASE DEMONSTRATION   ");
            System.out.println("=".repeat(50));
            
            // Execute the complete ModifyComment flow
            boolean success = service.executeModifyCommentFlow();
            
            if (success) {
                System.out.println("Use case completed successfully!");
            } else {
                System.out.println("Use case did not complete successfully.");
            }
            
            // Show final state
            displayCommentSummary();
        }
        
        /**
         * Displays a summary of comments after modification.
         */
        private void displayCommentSummary() {
            System.out.println("\n=== Final Comment Summary ===");
            var touristComments = site.getCommentsByTourist(tourist.getId());
            
            if (touristComments.isEmpty()) {
                System.out.println("You have no comments on this site.");
            } else {
                System.out.println("Your current comments on this site:");
                for (Comment comment : touristComments) {
                    String modifiedInfo = comment.isModified() ? 
                            " (Modified: " + comment.getModifiedAt().toLocalTime() + ")" : 
                            " (Original)";
                    System.out.println("- " + comment.getContent() + modifiedInfo);
                }
            }
        }
        
        /**
         * Demonstrates edge cases and error handling.
         */
        private void demonstrateEdgeCases() {
            System.out.println("\n\n" + "=".repeat(50));
            System.out.println("   EDGE CASES AND ERROR HANDLING DEMO   ");
            System.out.println("=".repeat(50));
            
            // Test 1: Try to modify a comment with empty content
            System.out.println("\n--- Test 1: Empty Comment Content ---");
            testEmptyCommentContent();
            
            // Test 2: Try to modify a comment that doesn't belong to tourist
            System.out.println("\n--- Test 2: Unauthorized Comment Modification ---");
            testUnauthorizedModification();
            
            // Test 3: Server disconnection scenario
            System.out.println("\n--- Test 3: Server Connection Interruption ---");
            testServerDisconnection();
        }
        
        /**
         * Tests the error case for empty comment content.
         */
        private void testEmptyCommentContent() {
            Comment comment = site.getCommentsByTourist(tourist.getId()).get(0);
            System.out.println("Attempting to modify comment with empty content...");
            
            try {
                // This should throw an exception
                comment.modifyContent("");
                System.out.println("ERROR: Should have thrown exception for empty content!");
            } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
                System.out.println("✓ Correctly caught exception: " + e.getMessage());
            }
        }
        
        /**
         * Tests unauthorized comment modification attempt.
         */
        private void testUnauthorizedModification() {
            // Get a comment that doesn't belong to our tourist
            Comment otherTouristComment = site.getComment("C003");
            if (otherTouristComment != null) {
                System.out.println("Comment by another tourist: " + otherTouristComment.getContent());
                System.out.println("Checking if our tourist can modify it...");
                
                boolean canModify = tourist.canModifyComment(otherTouristComment);
                System.out.println("Tourist can modify comment: " + canModify + 
                        " (Expected: false)");
                
                if (!canModify) {
                    System.out.println("✓ Security check passed: Tourist cannot modify " +
                            "comments by other tourists.");
                }
            }
        }
        
        /**
         * Tests server disconnection scenario.
         */
        private void testServerDisconnection() {
            System.out.println("Current server connection status: " + 
                    (service.isConnectedToServer() ? "Connected" : "Disconnected"));
            
            System.out.println("Simulating server disconnection...");
            service.simulateServerDisconnection();
            
            System.out.println("Attempting to modify a comment after disconnection...");
            Comment comment = site.getCommentsByTourist(tourist.getId()).get(0);
            
            // This should fail due to server disconnection
            boolean success = service.modifyComment(comment.getId(), 
                    "Test content after disconnection", false);
            
            System.out.println("Modification successful: " + success + 
                    " (Expected: false due to server disconnection)");
            
            // Reconnect for cleanup
            System.out.println("Reconnecting to server for cleanup...");
            service.reconnectToServer();
        }
        
        /**
         * Cleans up resources used by the application.
         */
        private void cleanup() {
            System.out.println("\n=== Application Cleanup ===");
            
            if (service != null) {
                service.close();
                System.out.println("Comment modification service closed.");
            }
            
            System.out.println("\n" + "=".repeat(50));
            System.out.println("   APPLICATION TERMINATED SUCCESSFULLY   ");
            System.out.println("=".repeat(50));
            System.out.println("\nThank you for using ETOUR Comment System!");
        }
    }
}

an existing plan to achieve the goal. A plan consists of one to 3 tasks.\nIf plan is created, you should track the progress and update the plan accordingly, such as Plan.finish_current_task, Plan.append_task, Plan.reset_task, Plan.replace_task, etc.\nWhen presented a current task, tackle the task using the available commands.\nPay close attention to new user message, review the conversation history, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to respond to new user requirement.\nNote:\n1. If you keeping encountering errors, unexpected situation, or you are not sure of proceeding, use RoleZero.ask_human to ask for help.\n2. Carefully review your progress at the current task, if your actions so far has not fulfilled the task instruction, you should continue with current task. Otherwise, finish current task by Plan.finish_current_task explicitly.\n3. Each time you finish a task, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to report your progress.\n4. Don\'t forget to append task first when all existing tasks are finished and new tasks are required.\n5. Avoid repeating tasks you have already completed. And end loop when all requirements are met.\nYou are an autonomous programmer\n\nThe special interface consists of a file editor that shows you 100 lines of a file at a time.\n\nYou can use terminal commands (e.g., cat, ls, cd) by calling Terminal.run_command.\n\nYou should carefully observe the behavior and results of the previous action, and avoid triggering repeated errors.\n\nIn addition to the terminal, I also provide additional tools. \n\nIf provided an issue link, you first action must be navigate to the issue page using Browser tool to understand the issue.\n\nYour must check if the repository exists at the current path. If it exists, navigate to the repository path. If the repository doesn\'t exist, please download it and then navigate to it.\nAll subsequent actions must be performed within this repository path. Do not leave this directory to execute any actions at any time.\n\nNote:\n\n1. If you open a file and need to get to an area around a specific line that is not in the first 100 lines, say line 583, don\'t just use the scroll_down command multiple times. Instead, use the Editor.goto_line command. It\'s much quicker. \n2. Always make sure to look at the currently open file and the current working directory (which appears right after the currently open file). The currently open file might be in a different directory than the working directory! Note that some commands, such as \'create\', open files, so they might change the current open file.\n3. When using Editor.edit_file_by_replace, if there is no exact match, take the difference in indentation into consideration.\n4. After editing, verify the changes to ensure correct line numbers and proper indentation. Adhere to PEP8 standards for Python code.\n5. NOTE ABOUT THE EDIT COMMAND: Indentation really matters! When editing a file, make sure to insert appropriate indentation before each line! Ensuring the code adheres to PEP8 standards. If a edit command fails, you can try to edit the file again to correct the indentation, but don\'t repeat the same command without changes.\n6. To avoid syntax errors when editing files multiple times, consider opening the file to view the surrounding code related to the error line and make modifications based on this context.\n7. Ensure to observe the currently open file and the current working directory, which is displayed right after the open file. The open file might be in a different directory than the working directory. Remember, commands like \'create\' open files and might alter the current open file.\n8. Effectively using Use search commands (`search_dir`, `search_file`, `find_file`) and navigation commands (`open_file`, `goto_line`) to locate and modify files efficiently. The Editor tool can fully satisfy the requirements. Follow these steps and considerations for optimal results:\n\n9. When the edit fails, try to enlarge the range of code.\n10. You must use the Editor.open_file command to open a file before using the Editor tool\'s edit command to modify it. When you open a file, any currently open file will be automatically closed.\n11. Remember, when you use Editor.insert_content_at_line or Editor.edit_file_by_replace, the line numbers will change after the operation. Therefore, if there are multiple operations, perform only the first operation in the current response, and defer the subsequent operations to the next turn.\n11.1 Do not use Editor.insert_content_at_line or Editor.edit_file_by_replace more than once per command list.\n12. If you choose Editor.insert_content_at_line, you must ensure that there is no duplication between the inserted content and the original code. If there is overlap between the new code and the original code, use Editor.edit_file_by_replace instead.\n13. If you choose Editor.edit_file_by_replace, the original code that needs to be replaced must start at the beginning of the line and end at the end of the line\n14. When not specified, you should write files in a folder named "{project_name}_1766846155". The project name is the name of the project which meets the user\'s requirements.\n15. When provided system design or project schedule, you MUST read them first before making a plan, then adhere to them in your implementation, especially in the programming language, package, or framework. You MUST implement all code files prescribed in the system design or project schedule.\n16. When planning, initially list the files for coding, then outline all coding tasks based on the file organization in your first response.\n17. If you plan to read a file, do not include other plans in the same response.\n18. Write only one code file each time and provide its full implementation.\n19. When the requirement is simple, you don\'t need to create a plan, just do it right away.\n20. When using the editor, pay attention to current directory. When you use editor tools, the paths must be either absolute or relative to the editor\'s current directory.\n21. When planning, consider whether images are needed. If you are developing a showcase website, start by using ImageGetter.get_image to obtain the necessary images.\n22. When planning, merge multiple tasks that operate on the same file into a single task. For example, create one task for writing unit tests for all functions in a class. Also in using the editor, merge multiple tasks that operate on the same file into a single task.\n23. When create unit tests for a code file, use Editor.read() to read the code file before planing. And create one plan to writing the unit test for the whole file.\n24. The priority to select technology stacks: Describe in Sytem Design and Project Schedule > Vite, React, MUI and Tailwind CSS > native HTML \n24.1. The React template is in the "/home///baselines/MetaGPT/template/react_template" and Vue template is in the "/home///baselines/MetaGPT/template/vue_template". \n25.  // Unique identifier for the site\n    private final String name;                  // Name of the site\n    private final String description;          // Description of the site\n    private final  // Total number of comments on this site\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor for creating a new Site.\n     * \n     * @param id Unique identifier for the site\n     * @param name Name of the site\n || name.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Site name cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n        if (description == null || description.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Site description cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Adds a comment to the site.\n     * This method is called when a tourist posts a new comment on the site.\n     * \n     * @param comment The comment to add\n     * @return true if comment was added successfully, false otherwise\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if comment is null or doesn\'t belong to this site\n     */\n    public boolean addComment(Comment comment) {\n        if (comment == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Comment cannot be null");\n        }\n        \n        if (!this.id.equals(comment.getSiteId())) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Comment does not belong to this site");\n        }\n        \n        // Check if comment already exists\n        if (comments.containsKey(comment.getId())) {\n            return false; // Comment already exists\n        }\n        \n        // Add the comment The Comment object, or null if not found\n     */\n    public Comment getComment(String commentId) {\n        if (commentId == null || commentId.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return null;\n        }\n        return comments.get(commentId);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets all comments for this site.\n     * \n     * @return List of all comments on this site\n     */\n    public List<Comment> getAllComments() {\n        return new ArrayList<>(comments.values()); // Return a copy for immutability\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets comments written by a specific tourist.\n     * \n     * List<Comment> touristComments = new ArrayList<>();\n        \n        if (touristId == null || touristId.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return touristComments;\n        }\n        \n        for (Comment comment : comments.values()) {\n            if (touristId.equals(comment.getAuthorId())) {\n                touristComments.add(comment);\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return touristComments;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Updates a comment on the site.\n     * This method is used to modify an existing comment.\n     * \n     * @param commentId The ID of the comment to invalid\n     */\n    public boolean updateComment(String commentId, String newContent) {\n        if (commentId == null || commentId.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Comment ID cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n        \n        if (newContent == null || newContent.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new site.getName());\n        System.out.println("Tourist: " + tourist.getFullName());\n        \n        // Check connection to server ETOUR\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n          \n            try {\n                // This should throw an exception\n                comment.modifyContent("");\n                System.out.println("ERROR: Should have thrown exception for   /**\n         * Tests unauthorized comment modification attempt.\n         */\n        private void testUnauthorizedModification() {\n            // Get a comment that doesn\'t belong to our tourist\n            Comment otherTouristComment = site.getComment("C003");\n            if (otherTouristComment != null) {\n                System.out.println("Comment by another tourist: " + tourist.canModifyComment(otherTouristComment);\n                System.out.println("Tourist can modify comment: " + canModify + \n                        " (Expected: false)");\n                \n                if (!canModify) {\n                    System.out.println("✓ Security check passed: Tourist cannot modify " +\n                            "comments by other tourists.");\n                }\n            }\n        }\n        \n        /**\n         * Tests server disconnection scenario.\n         */\n        private void testServerDisconnection() {\n            System.out.println("Current server connection status: " + \n                    (service.isConnectedToServer() ? "Connected" : "Disconnected"));\n            \n            System.out.println("Simulating server disconnection...");\n            service.simulateServerDisconnection();\n            \n            System.out.println("Attempting to modify a comment after disconnection...");\n            Comment comment = site.getCommentsByTourist(tourist.getId()).get(0);\n            \n            // This should fail due to server disconnection\n            boolean success = service.modifyComment(comment.getId(), \n                    "Test content after disconnection", false);\n            \n            System.out.println("Modification successful: " + success + \n                    " (Expected: false due to server disconnection)");\n            \n            // Reconnect for cleanup\n            System.out.println("Reconnecting to server for cleanup...");\n            service.reconnectToServer();\n        }\n        \n        /**\n         * Cleans up resources used by the application.\n         */\n        private void cleanup() {\n            System.out.println("\\n=== Application Cleanup ===");\n            \n            if (service != null) {\n                service.close();\n                System.out.println("Comment modification service closed.");\n            }\n            \n            System.out.println("\\n" + "=".repeat(50));\n            System.out.println("   APPLICATION TERMINATED SUCCESSFULLY   ");\n            System.out.println("=".repeat(50));\n            System.out.println("\\nThank you for using ETOUR Comment System!");\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nCommand Plan.finish_current_task executed:Current task is finished. site.getName());\n        System.out.println("Tourist: " + tourist.getFullName());\n        \n        // Check connection to server ETOUR\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 1: Choose to change comment on feedback\n        Comment Please enter a number between 1 and " + touristComments.size());\n                return null;\n            }\n            \n            Comment selectedComment = touristComments.get(choice - 1);\n            System.out.println("Selected comment: " + selectedComment.getContent());\n            return selectedComment;\n            \n        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n            System.out.println("Invalid input. The view from the top was breathtaking.", \n                    tourist.getId(), site.getId());\n            \n            Comment comment2 = new Comment("C002", \n                    "The queues were very long, but it was worth the wait. Highly recommended!", \n                    tourist.getId(), site.getId());\n            \n            Comment comment3 = new Comment("C003", \n                    "Great historical site. The lighting at night is beautiful.", \n                    "T002", site.getId()); // Comment by another tourist\n            \n            // Add comments to site\n            site.addComment(comment1);\n            site.addComment(comment2);\n            site.addComment(comment3);\n            \n            // Register comments with tourist\n            tourist.addComment(comment1.getId());\n            tourist.addComment(comment2.getId());\n            \n            System.out.println("Created " + site.getTotalComments() + " sample comments for the site.");\n            \n            // Display comment summary\n            System.out.println("Tourist " + tourist.getFullName() + " has " + \n                    tourist.getCommentIds().size() + " comments on this site.");\n        }\n        \n        /**\n         * Simulates tourist authentication.\n         * \n         * @return true if authentication successful, false otherwise\n         */\n        private boolean authenticateTourist() {\n            // In a real application, this would involve proper authentication\n            // For demonstration, we\'ll use a simple token\n            String authToken = "VALID_TOKEN_T001";\n            \n            System.out.println("Authenticating tourist " + tourist.getUsername() + "...");\n            boolean authenticated = tourist.authenticate(authToken);\n            \n            if (authenticated) {\n                System.out.println("✓ Authentication successful!");\n                return true;\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("✗ Authentication failed. Please check your credentials.");\n                return false;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        /**\n         * Displays site information to the tourist.\n         */\n        private void displaySiteInformation() {\n            System.out.println("\\n=== Site Details ===");\n            System.out.println("Site: " + site.getName());\n            System.out.println("Description: " + site.getDescription());\n            System.out.println("Average Rating: " + site.getAverageRating() + "/5.0");\n            System.out.println("Total Comments: " + site.getTotalComments());\n            \n            // Display tourist\'s comments on this site\n            var touristComments = site.getCommentsByTourist(tourist.getId());\n            if (!touristComments.isEmpty()) {\n                System.out.println("\\nYour comments on this site:");\n                for (int i = 0; i < touristComments.size(); i++) {\n                    Comment comment = touristComments.get(i);\n                    System.out.println((i + 1) + ". [" + comment.getCreatedAt().toLocalDate() + \n                            "] " + comment.getContent());\n                }\n            }\n        }\n        \n        /**\n         * Runs the main ModifyComment use case.\n         */\n        private void runModifyCommentUseCase() {\n            System.out.println("\\n\\n" + "=".repeat(50));\n            System.out.println("   MODIFY COMMENT USE CASE DEMONSTRATION   ");\n            System.out.println("=".repeat(50));\n            \n            // Execute the complete ModifyComment flow\n            boolean success = service.executeModifyCommentFlow();\n            \n            if (success) {\n                System.out.println("Use case completed successfully!");\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Use case did not complete successfully.");\n            }\n            \n            // Show final state\n            displayCommentSummary();\n        }\n        \n        /**\n         * Displays a summary of comments after modification.\n         */\n        private void displayCommentSummary() {\n            System.out.println("\\n=== Final Comment Summary ===");\n            var touristComments = site.getCommentsByTourist(tourist.getId());\n            \n            if (touristComments.isEmpty()) {\n                System.out.println("You have no comments on this site.");\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Your current comments on this site:");\n                for (Comment comment : touristComments) {\n                    String modifiedInfo = comment.isModified() ? \n                            " (Modified: " + comment.getModifiedAt().toLocalTime() + ")" : \n                            " (Original)";\n                    System.out.println("- " + comment.getContent() + modifiedInfo);\n                }\n            }\n        }\n        \n        /**\n         * Demonstrates edge cases and error handling.\n         */\n        private void demonstrateEdgeCases() {\n            System.out.println("\\n\\n" + "=".repeat(50));\n            System.out.println("   EDGE CASES AND ERROR HANDLING DEMO   ");\n            System.out.println("=".repeat(50));\n            \n            // Test 1: Try to modify a comment with empty content\n            System.out.println("\\n--- Test 1: Empty Comment Content ---");\n            testEmptyCommentContent();\n            \n            // Test 2: Try to modify a comment that doesn\'t belong to tourist\n            System.out.println("\\n--- Test 2: Unauthorized Comment Modification ---");\n            testUnauthorizedModification();\n            \n            // Test 3: Server disconnection scenario\n            System.out.println("\\n--- Test 3: Server Connection Interruption ---");\n            testServerDisconnection();\n        }\n        \n        /**\n         * Tests the error case for empty comment content.\n         */\n        private void testEmptyCommentContent() {\n            Comment comment = site.getCommentsByTourist(tourist.getId()).get(0);\n            System.out.println("Attempting to modify comment with empty content...");\n            \n            try {\n                // This should throw an exception\n                comment.modifyContent("");\n                System.out.println("ERROR: Should have thrown exception for empty content!");\n            } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {\n                System.out.println("✓ Correctly caught exception: " + e.getMessage());\n            }\n        }\n        \n        /**\n         * Tests unauthorized comment modification attempt.\n         */\n        private void testUnauthorizedModification() {\n            // Get a comment that doesn\'t belong to our tourist\n            Comment otherTouristComment = site.getComment("C003");\n            if (otherTouristComment != null) {\n                System.out.println("Comment by another tourist: " + otherTouristComment.getContent());\n                System.out.println("Checking if our tourist can modify it...");\n                \n                boolean canModify = tourist.canModifyComment(otherTouristComment);\n                System.out.println("Tourist can modify comment: " + canModify + \n                        " (Expected: false)");\n                \n                if (!canModify) {\n                    System.out.println("✓ Security check passed: Tourist cannot modify " +\n                            "comments by other tourists.");\n                }\n            }\n        }\n        \n        /**\n         * Tests server disconnection scenario.\n         */\n        private void testServerDisconnection() {\n            System.out.println("Current server connection status: " + \n                    (service.isConnectedToServer() ? "Connected" : "Disconnected"));\n            \n            System.out.println("Simulating server disconnection...");\n            service.simulateServerDisconnection();\n            \n            System.out.println("Attempting to modify a comment after disconnection...");\n            Comment comment = site.getCommentsByTourist(tourist.getId()).get(0);\n            \n            // This should fail due to server disconnection\n            boolean success = service.modifyComment(comment.getId(), \n                    "Test content after disconnection", false);\n            \n            System.out.println("Modification successful: " + success + \n                    " (Expected: false due to server disconnection)");\n            \n            // Reconnect for cleanup\n            System.out.println("Reconnecting to server for cleanup...");\n            service.reconnectToServer();\n        }\n        \n        /**\n         * Cleans up resources used by the application.\n         */\n        private void cleanup() {\n            System.out.println("\\n=== Application Cleanup ===");\n            \n            if (service != null) {\n                service.close();\n                System.out.println("Comment modification service closed.");\n            }\n            \n            System.out.println("\\n" + "=".repeat(50));\n            System.out.println("   APPLICATION TERMINATED SUCCESSFULLY   ");\n            System.out.println("=".repeat(50));\n            System.out.println("\\nThank you for using ETOUR Comment System!");\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nCommand Plan.finish_current_task executed:Current task is finished.  // Unique identifier for the site\n    private final String name;                  // Name of the site\n    private final String description;          // Description of the site\n    private final  // Total number of comments on this site\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor for creating a new Site.\n     * \n     * @param id Unique identifier for the site\n     * @param name Name of the site\n || name.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Site name cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n        if (description == null || description.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Site description cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Adds a comment to the site.\n     * This method is called when a tourist posts a new comment on the site.\n     * \n     * @param comment The comment to add\n     * @return true if comment was added successfully, false otherwise\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if comment is null or doesn\'t belong to this site\n     */\n    public boolean addComment(Comment comment) {\n        if (comment == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Comment cannot be null");\n        }\n        \n        if (!this.id.equals(comment.getSiteId())) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Comment does not belong to this site");\n        }\n        \n        // Check if comment already exists\n        if (comments.containsKey(comment.getId())) {\n            return false; // Comment already exists\n        }\n        \n        // Add the comment The Comment object, or null if not found\n     */\n    public Comment getComment(String commentId) {\n        if (commentId == null || commentId.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return null;\n        }\n        return comments.get(commentId);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets all comments for this site.\n     * \n     * @return List of all comments on this site\n     */\n    public List<Comment> (Comment comment : comments.values()) {\n            if (touristId.equals(comment.getAuthorId())) {\n                touristComments.add(comment);\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return IllegalArgumentException("New content cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n        \n        Comment comment = comments.get(commentId);\n        if (comment == null) {\n            return false; // commentId.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        Comment removedComment = comments.remove(commentId);\n        if (removedComment != null) {\n     \n        this.site = site;\n        this.tourist = tourist;\n        this.isConnectedToServer = true; // Assume connected initially\n        this.scanner = new Scanner(System.in);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main method to execute the comment modification process.\n     * This method orchestrates the entire flow of the use case.\n     * \n     * @return true if comment was successfully site.getName());\n        System.out.println("Tourist: " + tourist.getFullName());\n        \n        // Check connection to server ETOUR\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 1: Choose to change comment on feedback\n        Comment commentToModify = selectCommentToModify();\n        if (commentToModify == null) {\n            System.out.println("No comment selected for modification.");\n            return false;\n        }\n System.out.println("Error: Invalid comment content provided.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Ask for confirmation\n        if (!askForConfirmation(commentToModify, newContent)) {\n            System.out.println("Comment modification cancelled by user.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 3: Confirm change (implied by user confirmation)\n        // Step 4: Edit commentary on selected feedback\n        boolean modificationSuccessful = performCommentModification(commentToModify, newContent);\n        \n        // Exit: System shall notify alterations\n        if (modificationSuccessful) {\n            notifyAlterations(commentToModify);\n        }\n        \n        return modificationSuccessful;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Selects a comment to modify from the tourist\'s comments on this site.\n     * This implements Step 1 of the use case flow.\n     * \n     * @return The selected comment to modify, or null if no valid selection\n     */\n    private Comment selectCommentToModify() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 1: Select Comment to Modify ---");\n        \n        // Get all comments by this tourist on this site\n        var touristComments = site.getCommentsByTourist(tourist.getId());\n        \n        if (touristComments.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("You have no comments on this site to modify.");\n            return null;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("Your comments on this site:");\n        for (int i = 0; i < touristComments.size(); i++) [%s] %s%n", \n                i + 1, \n                comment.getCreatedAt().toString(), \n                comment.getContent().length() > 50 ? \n                    comment.getContent().substring(0, 47) + "..." : \n                    comment.getContent());\n        }\n        \n        System.out.print("\\nEnter the number of the comment you want to modify (or 0 to cancel): ");\n        \n        try {\n            int choice = Integer.parseInt(scanner.nextLine().trim());\n            \n            if (choice == 0) {\n                System.out.println("Operation cancelled.");\n                return null;\n            }\n            \n            if (choice < 1 || choice > touristComments.size()) {\n                System.out.println("Invalid selection. Please enter a number between 1 and " + touristComments.size());\n                return null;\n            }\n            \n            Comment selectedComment = touristComments.get(choice - 1);\n            System.out.println("Selected comment: " + selectedComment.getContent());\n            return selectedComment;\n            \n        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n            System.out.println("Invalid input. Please enter a valid number.");\n            return null;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets new comment content from the user.\n     * This is part of Step 2 of the use case flow.\n     * \n     * @return The new comment content entered by the user\n     */\n    private String getNewCommentContent() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 2: Enter New Comment Content ---");\n newContent The new comment content to validate\n     * @return true if content is valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean validateNewContent(String newContent) {\n        if (newContent == null || newContent.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Comment content cannot be empty.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (newContent.length() < 5) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Comment must be at least 5 characters long.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (newContent.length() > 1000) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Comment cannot exceed 1000 characters.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check for inappropriate content (basic example)\n        String[] inappropriateWords = {"spam", "advertisement", "offensive"};\n        String lowerContent = newContent.toLowerCase();\n        for (String word : inappropriateWords) {\n            if askForConfirmation(Comment comment, String newContent) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Confirm Modification ---");\n        System.out.println("Original comment: " + comment.getContent());\n        System.out.println("New comment: " + newContent);\n        System.out.println("\\nAre you sure you want to modify this comment? (yes/no)");\n        System.out.print("> ");\n        \n        String response = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n        return response.equals("yes") || response.equals("y");\n    }\n in real system, this would be more complex\n        this.isAuthenticated = authenticationToken.equals("VALID_TOKEN_" + this.id);\n        return this.isAuthenticated;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * this tourist\n     */\n    public void addComment(String commentId) {\n        if (commentId != null && !commentId.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            commentIds.add(commentId);\n        }\n    }\n    \n site.getName());\n        System.out.println("Tourist: " + tourist.getFullName());\n        \n        // Check connection to server ETOUR\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 1: Choose to change comment on feedback\n        Comment newContent)) {\n            System.out.println("Comment modification cancelled by user.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 3: Confirm change (implied by user /**\n     * Selects a comment to modify from the tourist\'s comments on this site.\n     * This implements Step 1 of the use case flow.\n     * \n     * @return The selected comment to modify, or null Please enter a number between 1 and " + touristComments.size());\n                return null;\n            }\n            \n            Comment selectedComment = touristComments.get(choice - 1);\n            System.out.println("Selected comment: " + selectedComment.getContent());\n            return selectedComment;\n            \n        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n            System.out.println("Invalid input. 5) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Comment must be at least 5 characters long.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (newContent.length() > 1000) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Comment cannot exceed 1000 characters.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check for inappropriate content (basic example)\n        String[]
