Where the data is invalid or insufficient, the system \n * activates the use case Errored."\n * \n * This exception is thrown when comment validation fails due to:\n * - Empty or null content\n * - Content that\'s too short or too long\n * - Content containing inappropriate words\n * - Any other validation rule violation\n */\npublic class InvalidCommentException extends ModifyCommentException {\n    \n    private final String fieldName;\n    private final String invalidValue;\n    private final String validationRule;\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructs a new InvalidCommentException with the specified detail message.\n     * \n     * @param message the detail message explaining the validation error\n     */\n    public InvalidCommentException(String message) {\n        super(message);\n        this.fieldName = "content";\n        this.invalidValue = null;\n        this.validationRule = null;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructs a new InvalidCommentException with detailed field information.\n     * \n     * @param fieldName the name of the field that failed validation\n     * @param invalidValue the invalid value that caused the failure\n     * @param validationRule the validation rule that was violated\n     * @param message the detail message explaining the validation error\n     */\n    public InvalidCommentException(String fieldName, String invalidValue, \n                                   String validationRule, String message) {\n        super(message);\n        this.fieldName = fieldName;\n        this.invalidValue = invalidValue;\n        this.validationRule = validationRule;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructs a new InvalidCommentException with the specified detail message and cause.\n     * \n     * @param message the detail message explaining the validation error\n     * @param cause the underlying cause of the exception\n     */\n    public InvalidCommentException(String message, Throwable cause) {\n        super(message, cause);\n        this.fieldName = "content";\n        this.invalidValue = null;\n        this.validationRule = null;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the name of the field that failed validation.\n     * \n     * @return the field name\n     */\n    public String getFieldName() {\n        return fieldName;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the invalid value that caused the validation failure.\n     * \n     * @return the invalid value, or null if not specified\n     */\n    public String getInvalidValue() {\n        return invalidValue;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the validation rule that was violated.\n     * \n     * @return the validation rule, or null if not specified\n     */\n    public String getValidationRule() {\n        return validationRule;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets a user-friendly error message for display to the tourist.\n     * Overrides the base implementation to provide more specific guidance.\n     * \n     * @return a formatted error message suitable for user display\n     */\n    @Override\n    public String getUserFriendlyMessage() {\n        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();\n        sb.append("Comment Validation Error\\n\\n");\n        sb.append("We encountered an issue with your comment:\\n");\n        sb.append("• ").append(getMessage()).append("\\n\\n");\n        \n        if (fieldName != null) {\n            sb.append("Field: ").append(fieldName).append("\\n");\n        }\n        \n        if (validationRule != null) {\n            sb.append("Rule: ").append(validationRule).append("\\n");\n        }\n        \n        sb.append("\\nPlease correct the issue and try again.");\n        \n        return sb.toString();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets a detailed error message for logging and debugging purposes.\n     * \n     * @return a detailed error message including validation details\n     */\n    @Override\n    public String getDetailedErrorMessage() {\n        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();\n        sb.append("InvalidCommentException: ").append(getMessage()).append("\\n");\n        sb.append("Timestamp: ").append(java.time.LocalDateTime.now()).append("\\n");\n        \n        if (fieldName != null) {\n            sb.append("Field: ").append(fieldName).append("\\n");\n        }\n        \n        if (invalidValue != null) {\n            sb.append("Invalid Value: \'").append(invalidValue).append("\'\\n");\n        }\n        \n        if (validationRule != null) {\n            sb.append("Validation Rule: ").append(validationRule).append("\\n");\n        }\n        \n        if (getCause() != null) {\n            sb.append("Caused by: ").append(getCause().getClass().getName())\n              .append(" - ").append(getCause().getMessage()).append("\\n");\n        }\n        \n        return sb.toString();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a specific InvalidCommentException for empty content.\n     * \n     * @return an InvalidCommentException for empty content\n     */\n    public static InvalidCommentException forEmptyContent() {\n        return new InvalidCommentException(\n            "content", \n            "", \n            "Comment content cannot be empty or null", \n            "Comment content is required and cannot be empty."\n        );\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a specific InvalidCommentException for content that\'s too short.\n     * \n     * @param actualLength the actual length of the content\n     * @param minLength the minimum required length\n     * @return an InvalidCommentException for content that\'s too short\n     */\n    public static InvalidCommentException forContentTooShort(int actualLength, int minLength) {\n        return new InvalidCommentException(\n            "content",\n            "(content length: " + actualLength + ")",\n            "Minimum length: " + minLength + " characters",\n            "Comment must be at least " + minLength + " characters long. " +\n            "Current length: " + actualLength + " characters."\n        );\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a specific InvalidCommentException for content that\'s too long.\n     * \n     * @param actualLength the actual length of the content\n     * @param maxLength the maximum allowed length\n     * @return an InvalidCommentException for content that\'s too long\n     */\n    public static InvalidCommentException forContentTooLong(int actualLength, int maxLength) {\n        return new InvalidCommentException(\n            "content",\n            "(content length: " + actualLength + ")",\n            "Maximum length: " + maxLength + " characters",\n            "Comment cannot exceed " + maxLength + " characters. " +\n            "Current length: " + actualLength + " characters."\n        );\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a specific InvalidCommentException for inappropriate content.\n     * \n     * @param inappropriateWord the inappropriate word found in the content\n     * @return an InvalidCommentException for inappropriate content\n     */\n    public static InvalidCommentException forInappropriateContent(String inappropriateWord) {\n        return new InvalidCommentException(\n            "content",\n            "(contains: \'" + inappropriateWord + "\')",\n            "No inappropriate content allowed",\n            "Comment contains inappropriate content: \'" + inappropriateWord + "\'. " +\n            "Please remove it and try again."\n        );\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a string representation of the exception for debugging.\n     * \n     * @return string representation including validation details\n     */\n    @Override\n    public String toString() {\n        return "InvalidCommentException{" +\n                "fieldName=\'" + fieldName + \'\\\'\' +\n                ", invalidValue=\'" + invalidValue + \'\\\'\' +\n                ", validationRule=\'" + validationRule + \'\\\'\' +\n                ", message=\'" + getMessage() + \'\\\'\' +\n                \'}\';\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'user', 'content': "\n# User Requirement\n[Message] from Mike to Alex: Write a complete Java program based on the given use case 'ModifyComment'. 2025-12-27 22:47:53.871 | INFO     | metagpt.roles.di.role_zero:_act:294 - Commands outputs: 
Command Engineer2.write_new_code executed: The file /home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/ModifyCommentApp_1766846155/src/main/java/com/etour/modifycomment/exceptions/UnauthorizedModificationException.java has been successfully created, with content:
package com.etour.modifycomment.exceptions;

/**
 * Exception thrown when a tourist attempts to modify a comment they don't own
 * or have permission to modify.
 * 
 * This represents a security violation in the ModifyComment use case.
 * Tourists can only modify their own comments, and attempting to modify
 * someone else's comment should trigger this exception.
 */
public class UnauthorizedModificationException extends ModifyCommentException {
    
    private final String touristId;
    private final String commentId;
    private final String commentAuthorId;
    
    /**
     * Constructs a new UnauthorizedModificationException with detailed information.
     * 
     * @param touristId the ID of the tourist attempting the modification
     * @param commentId the ID of the comment being modified
     * @param commentAuthorId the ID of the actual author of the comment
     * @param message the detail message explaining the security violation
     */
    public UnauthorizedModificationException(String touristId, String commentId, 
                                            String commentAuthorId, String message) {
        super(message);
        this.touristId = touristId;
        this.commentId = commentId;
        this.commentAuthorId = commentAuthorId;
    }
    
    /**
     * Constructs a new UnauthorizedModificationException with the specified detail message.
     * 
     * @param message the detail message explaining the security violation
     */
    public UnauthorizedModificationException(String message) {
        super(message);
        this.touristId = null;
        this.commentId = null;
        this.commentAuthorId = null;
    }
    
    /**
     * Constructs a new UnauthorizedModificationException with the specified detail message and cause.
     * 
     * @param message the detail message explaining the security violation
     * @param cause the underlying cause of the exception
     */
    public UnauthorizedModificationException(String message, Throwable cause) {
        super(message, cause);
        this.touristId = null;
        this.commentId = null;
        this.commentAuthorId = null;
    }
    
    /**
     * Gets the ID of the tourist who attempted the unauthorized modification.
     * 
     * @return the tourist ID, or null if not specified
     */
    public String getTouristId() {
        return touristId;
    }
    
    /**
     * Gets the ID of the comment that was attempted to be modified.
     * 
     * @return the comment ID, or null if not specified
     */
    public String getCommentId() {
        return commentId;
    }
    
    /**
     * Gets the ID of the actual author of the comment.
     * 
     * @return the author ID, or null if not specified
     */
    public String getCommentAuthorId() {
        return commentAuthorId;
    }
    
    /**
     * Gets a user-friendly error message for display to the tourist.
     * Overrides the base implementation to provide security-specific guidance.
     * 
     * @return a formatted error message suitable for user display
     */
    @Override
    public String getUserFriendlyMessage() {
        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
        sb.append("Unauthorized Action\n\n");
        sb.append("You do not have permission to modify this comment.\n\n");
        
        if (touristId != null && commentAuthorId != null && !touristId.equals(commentAuthorId)) {
            sb.append("Reason: This comment was created by another tourist.\n");
            sb.append("Your ID: ").append(touristId).append("\n");
            sb.append("Comment Author ID: ").append(commentAuthorId).append("\n");
        }
        
        sb.append("\nYou can only modify comments that you have created.");
        
        return sb.toString();
    }
    
    /**
     * Gets a detailed error message for logging and debugging purposes.
     * This should be logged for security auditing.
     * 
     * @return a detailed error message including security audit details
     */
    @Override
    public String getDetailedErrorMessage() {
        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
        sb.append("UnauthorizedModificationException: ").append(getMessage()).append("\n");
        sb.append("Timestamp: ").append(java.time.LocalDateTime.now()).append("\n");
        
        if (touristId != null) {
            sb.append("Unauthorized Tourist ID: ").append(touristId).append("\n");
        }
        
        if (commentId != null) {
            sb.append("Target Comment ID: ").append(commentId).append("\n");
        }
        
        if (commentAuthorId != null) {
            sb.append("Comment Author ID: ").append(commentAuthorId).append("\n");
        }
        
        if (getCause() != null) {
            sb.append("Caused by: ").append(getCause().getClass().getName())
              .append(" - ").append(getCause().getMessage()).append("\n");
        }
        
        sb.append("Security Audit: This unauthorized access attempt has been logged.");
        
        return sb.toString();
    }
    
    /**
     * Creates a specific UnauthorizedModificationException for when a tourist
     * tries to modify someone else's comment.
     * 
     * @param touristId the ID of the tourist attempting the modification
     * @param comment the comment being modified
     * @return an UnauthorizedModificationException for the security violation
     */
    public static UnauthorizedModificationException forOtherTouristComment(String touristId, Comment comment) {
        return new UnauthorizedModificationException(
            touristId,
            comment.getId(),
            comment.getAuthorId(),
            "Tourist " + touristId + " attempted to modify comment " + comment.getId() + 
            " which belongs to tourist " + comment.getAuthorId()
        );
    }
    
    /**
     * Creates a specific UnauthorizedModificationException for when an
     * unauthenticated tourist tries to modify a comment.
     * 
     * @param touristId the ID of the unauthenticated tourist
     * @param commentId the ID of the comment being modified
     * @return an UnauthorizedModificationException for unauthenticated access
     */
    public static UnauthorizedModificationException forUnauthenticatedTourist(String touristId, String commentId) {
        return new UnauthorizedModificationException(
            touristId,
            commentId,
            null,
            "Unauthenticated tourist " + touristId + " attempted to modify comment " + commentId
        );
    }
    
    /**
     * Creates a string representation of the exception for debugging.
     * 
     * @return string representation including security details
     */
    @Override
    public String toString() {
        return "UnauthorizedModificationException{" +
                "touristId='" + touristId + '\'' +
                ", commentId='" + commentId + '\'' +
                ", commentAuthorId='" + commentAuthorId + '\'' +
                ", message='" + getMessage() + '\'' +
                '}';
    }
}

Choose to change comment on feedback\n * 2. Verify data entered and ask for confirmation; if invalid, activate error case\n * 3. Confirm change\n * 4. Edit commentary on selected feedback\n * 5. Notify alterations\n * \n * The service also handles connection interruptions to server ETOUR.\n */\npublic class CommentModificationService {\n    private final Site site;\n    private final Tourist tourist;\n    private boolean isConnectedToServer;\n    private final Scanner scanner;\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor for CommentModificationService.\n     * \n     * @param site The site where comments are being modified\n     * @param tourist The tourist who is modifying comments\n     */\n    public CommentModificationService(Site site, Tourist tourist) {\n        if (site == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Site cannot be null");\n        }\n        if (tourist == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Tourist cannot be null");\n        }\n        \n        this.site = site;\n        this.tourist = tourist;\n        this.isConnectedToServer = true; // Assume connected initially\n        this.scanner = new Scanner(System.in);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main method to execute the comment modification process.\n     * This method orchestrates the entire flow of the use case.\n     * \n     * @return true if comment was successfully modified, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean executeModifyCommentFlow() {\n        System.out.println("=== Modify Comment Process ===");\n        System.out.println("Site: " + site.getName());\n        System.out.println("Tourist: " + tourist.getFullName());\n        \n        // Check connection to server ETOUR\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 1: Choose to change comment on feedback\n        Comment commentToModify = selectCommentToModify();\n        if (commentToModify == null) {\n            System.out.println("No comment selected for modification.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 2: Verify data entered and ask for confirmation\n        String newContent = getNewCommentContent();\n        if (!validateNewContent(newContent)) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Invalid comment content provided.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Ask for confirmation\n        if (!askForConfirmation(commentToModify, newContent)) {\n            System.out.println("Comment modification cancelled by user.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 3: Confirm change (implied by user confirmation)\n        // Step 4: Edit commentary on selected feedback\n        boolean modificationSuccessful = performCommentModification(commentToModify, newContent);\n        \n        // Exit: System shall notify alterations\n        if (modificationSuccessful) {\n            notifyAlterations(commentToModify);\n        }\n        \n        return modificationSuccessful;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Selects a comment to modify from the tourist\'s comments on this site.\n     * This implements Step 1 of the use case flow.\n     * \n     * @return The selected comment to modify, or null if no valid selection\n     */\n    private Comment selectCommentToModify() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 1: Select Comment to Modify ---");\n        \n        // Get all comments by this tourist on this site\n        var touristComments = site.getCommentsByTourist(tourist.getId());\n        \n        if (touristComments.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("You have no comments on this site to modify.");\n            return null;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("Your comments on this site:");\n        for (int i = 0; i < touristComments.size(); i++) {\n            Comment comment = touristComments.get(i);\n            System.out.printf("%d. [%s] %s%n", \n                i + 1, \n                comment.getCreatedAt().toString(), \n                comment.getContent().length() > 50 ? \n                    comment.getContent().substring(0, 47) + "..." : \n                    comment.getContent());\n        }\n        \n        System.out.print("\\nEnter the number of the comment you want to modify (or 0 to cancel): ");\n        \n        try {\n            int choice = Integer.parseInt(scanner.nextLine().trim());\n            \n            if (choice == 0) {\n                System.out.println("Operation cancelled.");\n                return null;\n            }\n            \n            if (choice < 1 || choice > touristComments.size()) {\n                System.out.println("Invalid selection. Please enter a number between 1 and " + touristComments.size());\n                return null;\n            }\n            \n            Comment selectedComment = touristComments.get(choice - 1);\n            System.out.println("Selected comment: " + selectedComment.getContent());\n            return selectedComment;\n            \n        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n            System.out.println("Invalid input. Please enter a valid number.");\n            return null;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets new comment content from the user.\n     * This is part of Step 2 of the use case flow.\n     * \n     * @return The new comment content entered by the user\n     */\n    private String getNewCommentContent() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 2: Enter New Comment Content ---");\n        System.out.println("Please enter the new content for your comment:");\n        System.out.print("> ");\n        \n        return scanner.nextLine().trim();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates the new comment content.\n     * This implements the validation part of Step 2 of the use case flow.\n     * If data is invalid, the system should activate the error case.\n     * \n     * @param newContent The new comment content to validate\n     * @return true if content is valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean validateNewContent(String newContent) {\n        if (newContent == null || newContent.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Comment content cannot be empty.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (newContent.length() < 5) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Comment must be at least 5 characters long.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (newContent.length() > 1000) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Comment cannot exceed 1000 characters.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check for inappropriate content (basic example)\n        String[] inappropriateWords = {"spam", "advertisement", "offensive"};\n        String lowerContent = newContent.toLowerCase();\n        for (String word : inappropriateWords) {\n            if (lowerContent.contains(word)) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Comment contains inappropriate content.");\n                return false;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Asks the user for confirmation before modifying the comment.\n     * This implements the confirmation part of Step 2 of the use case flow.\n     * \n     * @param comment The comment to be modified\n     * @param newContent The new content for the comment\n     * @return true if user confirms, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean askForConfirmation(Comment comment, String newContent) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Confirm Modification ---");\n        System.out.println("Original comment: " + comment.getContent());\n        System.out.println("New comment: " + newContent);\n        System.out.println("\\nAre you sure you want to modify this comment? (yes/no)");\n        System.out.print("> ");\n        \n        String response = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n        return response.equals("yes") || response.equals("y");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Performs the actual comment modification.\n     * This implements Step 4 of the use case flow.\n     * \n     * @param comment The comment to modify\n     * @param newContent The new content for the comment\n     * @return true if modification was successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean performCommentModification(Comment comment, String newContent) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 4: Modifying Comment ---");\n        \n        // Check server connection again before modification\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection lost during modification process.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            // Check if tourist has permission to modify this comment\n            if (!tourist.canModifyComment(comment)) {\n                System.out.println("Error: You do not have permission to modify this comment.");\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            // Perform the modification\n            boolean success = comment.modifyContent(newContent);\n            \n            if (success) {\n                System.out.println("Comment successfully modified.");\n                return true;\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Comment was not modified (content unchanged).");\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error during modification: " + e.getMessage());\n            return false;\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            System.out.println("Unexpected error during modification: " + e.getMessage());\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Notifies the user about the alterations made to the comment.\n     * This implements the exit condition of the use case.\n     * \n     * @param modifiedComment The comment that was modified\n     */\n    private void notifyAlterations(Comment modifiedComment) {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Notification of Alterations ===");\n        System.out.println("Your comment has been successfully  // Total number of comments on this site\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor for creating a new Site.\n     * \n     * @param id Unique identifier for the site\n     * @param name Name of the site\n      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Site description cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Adds a comment to the site.\n     * This method is called when a tourist Choose to change comment on feedback\n * 2. Verify data entered and ask for confirmation; if invalid, activate error case\n * 3. Confirm change\n * 4. Edit commentary on selected feedback\n * 5. Notify alterations\n * \n * The service also handles connection interruptions to server ETOUR.\n */\npublic class CommentModificationService {\n    private final Site site;\n    private final Tourist tourist;\n    private boolean isConnectedToServer;\n    private final Scanner scanner;\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor for CommentModificationService.\n     * \n     * @param site The site where comments are being modified\n     * @param tourist The tourist who is modifying comments\n     */\n    public CommentModificationService(Site site, Tourist tourist) {\n        if (site == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Site cannot be null");\n        }\n        if (tourist == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Tourist cannot be null");\n        }\n        \n        this.site = site;\n        this.tourist = tourist;\n        this.isConnectedToServer = true; // Assume connected initially\n        this.scanner = new Scanner(System.in);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main method to execute the comment modification process.\n     * This method orchestrates the entire flow of the use case.\n     * \n     * @return true if comment was successfully modified, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean executeModifyCommentFlow() {\n        System.out.println("=== Modify Comment Process ===");\n        System.out.println("Site: " + site.getName());\n        System.out.println("Tourist: " + tourist.getFullName());\n        \n        // Check connection to server ETOUR\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 1: Choose to change comment on feedback\n        Comment commentToModify = selectCommentToModify();\n        if (commentToModify == null) {\n            System.out.println("No comment selected for modification.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 2: Verify data entered and ask for confirmation\n        String newContent = getNewCommentContent();\n        if (!validateNewContent(newContent)) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Invalid comment content provided.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Ask for confirmation\n        if (!askForConfirmation(commentToModify, newContent)) {\n            System.out.println("Comment modification cancelled by user.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 3: Confirm change (implied by user confirmation)\n        // Step 4: Edit commentary on selected feedback\n        boolean modificationSuccessful = performCommentModification(commentToModify, newContent);\n        \n        // Exit: System shall notify alterations\n        if (modificationSuccessful) {\n            notifyAlterations(commentToModify);\n        }\n        \n        return modificationSuccessful;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Selects a comment to modify from the tourist\'s comments on this site.\n     * This implements Step 1 of the use case flow.\n     * \n     * @return The selected comment to modify, or null if no valid selection\n     */\n    private Comment selectCommentToModify() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 1: Select Comment to Modify ---");\n        \n        // Get all comments by this tourist on this site\n        var touristComments = site.getCommentsByTourist(tourist.getId());\n        \n        if (touristComments.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("You have no comments on this site to modify.");\n            return null;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("Your comments on this site:");\n        for (int i = 0; i < touristComments.size(); i++) {\n            Comment comment = touristComments.get(i);\n            System.out.printf("%d. [%s] %s%n", \n                i + 1, \n                comment.getCreatedAt().toString(), \n                comment.getContent().length() > 50 ? \n                    comment.getContent().substring(0, 47) + "..." : \n                    comment.getContent());\n        }\n        \n        System.out.print("\\nEnter the number of the comment you want to modify (or 0 to cancel): ");\n        \n        try {\n            int choice = Integer.parseInt(scanner.nextLine().trim());\n            \n            if (choice == 0) {\n                System.out.println("Operation cancelled.");\n                return null;\n            }\n            \n            if (choice < 1 || choice > touristComments.size()) {\n                System.out.println("Invalid selection. Please enter a number between 1 and " + touristComments.size());\n                return null;\n            }\n            \n            Comment selectedComment = touristComments.get(choice - 1);\n            System.out.println("Selected comment: " + selectedComment.getContent());\n            return selectedComment;\n            \n        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n            System.out.println("Invalid input. Please enter a valid number.");\n            return null;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets new comment content from the user.\n     * This is part of Step 2 of the use case flow.\n     * \n     * @return The new comment content entered by the user\n     */\n    private String getNewCommentContent() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 2: Enter New Comment Content ---");\n        System.out.println("Please enter the new content for your comment:");\n        System.out.print("> ");\n        \n        return scanner.nextLine().trim();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates the new comment content.\n     * This implements the validation part of Step 2 of the use case flow.\n     * If data is invalid, the system should activate the error case.\n     * \n     * @param newContent The new comment content to validate\n     * @return true if content is valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean validateNewContent(String newContent) {\n        if (newContent == null || newContent.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Comment content cannot be empty.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (newContent.length() < 5) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Comment must be at least 5 characters long.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (newContent.length() > 1000) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Comment cannot exceed 1000 characters.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check for inappropriate content (basic example)\n        String[] inappropriateWords = {"spam", "advertisement", "offensive"};\n        String lowerContent = newContent.toLowerCase();\n        for (String word : inappropriateWords) {\n            if (lowerContent.contains(word)) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Comment contains inappropriate content.");\n                return false;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Asks the user for confirmation before modifying the comment.\n     * This implements the confirmation part of Step 2 of the use case flow.\n     * \n     * @param comment The comment to be modified\n     * @param newContent The new content for the comment\n     * @return true if user confirms, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean askForConfirmation(Comment comment, String newContent) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Confirm Modification ---");\n        System.out.println("Original comment: " + comment.getContent());\n        System.out.println("New comment: " + newContent);\n        System.out.println("\\nAre you sure you want to modify this comment? (yes/no)");\n        System.out.print("> ");\n        \n        String response = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n        return response.equals("yes") || response.equals("y");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Performs the actual comment modification.\n     * This implements Step 4 of the use case flow.\n     * \n     * @param comment The comment to modify\n     * @param newContent The new content for the comment\n     * @return true if modification was successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean performCommentModification(Comment comment, String newContent) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 4: Modifying Comment ---");\n        \n        // Check server connection again before modification\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection lost during modification process.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            // Check if tourist has permission to modify this comment\n            if (!tourist.canModifyComment(comment)) {\n                System.out.println("Error: You do not have permission to modify this comment.");\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            // Perform the modification\n            boolean success = comment.modifyContent(newContent);\n            \n            if (success) {\n                System.out.println("Comment successfully modified.");\n                return true;\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Comment was not modified (content unchanged).");\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error during modification: " + e.getMessage());\n            return false;\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            System.out.println("Unexpected error during modification: " + e.getMessage());\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Notifies the user about the alterations made to the comment.\n     * This implements the exit condition of the use case.\n     * \n     * @param modifiedComment The comment that was modified\n     */\n    private void notifyAlterations(Comment modifiedComment) {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Notification of Alterations ===");\n        System.out.println("Your comment has been successfully updated.");\n        System.out.println("Comment ID: " + modifiedComment.getId());\n        System.out.println("Modified at: " + modifiedComment.getModifiedAt());\n        System.out.println("New content: " + modifiedComment.getContent());\n        System.out.println("====================================\\n");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks the connection to the server ETOUR.\n     * This handles the interruption condition mentioned in the use case.\n     * \n     * @return true if connected to server, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean checkServerConnection() {\n        // In a real implementation, this would check actual server connectivity\n        // For this simulation, we\'ll use a simple flag that can be toggled\n        return isConnectedToServer;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates a server connection interruption.\n     * This method can be used to test the interruption handling.\n     */\n    public void simulateServerDisconnection() {\n        this.isConnectedToServer = false;\n        System.out.println("Simulated server disconnection.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Re-establishes server connection.\n     */\n    public void reconnectToServer() {\n        this.isConnectedToServer = true;\n        System.out.println("Reconnected to server.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the current server connection status.\n     * \n     * @return true if connected to server, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean isConnectedToServer() {\n        return isConnectedToServer;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Closes the scanner resource.\n     * This should be called when the service is no longer needed.\n     */\n    public void close() {\n        if (scanner != null) {\n            scanner.close();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Alternative method for modifying a comment without interactive prompts.\n     * This can be used for programmatic comment modification.\n     * \n     * @param commentId The ID of the comment to modify\n     * @param newContent The new content for the comment\n     * @param requireConfirmation Whether to require confirmation (simulated)\n     * @return true if modification was successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean modifyComment(String commentId, String newContent, boolean requireConfirmation) {\n        // Check server connection\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Get the comment\n        Comment comment = site.getComment(commentId);\n        if (comment == null) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Comment not found.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check permissions\n        if (!tourist.canModifyComment(comment)) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Tourist does not have permission to modify this comment.");\n            return false;\n a real implementation, this would involve user interaction\n        }\n        \n        // Perform modification\n        boolean success = comment.modifyContent(newContent);\n        \n        // Command Engineer2.write_new_code executed: The file /home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/ModifyCommentApp_1766846155/src/main/java/com/etour/modifycomment/exceptions/ServerConnectionException.java has been successfully created, with content:
package com.etour.modifycomment.exceptions;

/**
 * Exception thrown when there's a connection interruption to server ETOUR
 * as specified in the use case requirements.
 * 
 * The use case specifically mentions "Interruption of the connection to the server ETOUR"
 * as a scenario that needs to be handled.
 * 
 * This exception is thrown when the system cannot establish or maintain a connection
 * to the ETOUR server during the comment modification process.
 */
public class ServerConnectionException extends ModifyCommentException {
    
    private final String serverUrl;
    private final String operation;
    private final int retryCount;
    private final long timeoutMillis;
    
    /**
     * Constructs a new ServerConnectionException with detailed information.
     * 
     * @param serverUrl the URL of the ETOUR server that could not be reached
     * @param operation the operation that was being performed when the connection failed
     * @param retryCount the number of retry attempts that were made
     * @param timeoutMillis the timeout value in milliseconds
     * @param message the detail message explaining the connection failure
     */
    public ServerConnectionException(String serverUrl, String operation, 
                                     int retryCount, long timeoutMillis, String message) {
        super(message);
        this.serverUrl = serverUrl;
        this.operation = operation;
        this.retryCount = retryCount;
        this.timeoutMillis = timeoutMillis;
    }
    
    /**
     * Constructs a new ServerConnectionException with basic information.
     * 
     * @param message the detail message explaining the connection failure
     */
    public ServerConnectionException(String message) {
        super(message);
        this.serverUrl = "etour.example.com"; // Default ETOUR server
        this.operation = "comment_modification";
        this.retryCount = 0;
        this.timeoutMillis = 5000; // Default 5-second timeout
    }
    
    /**
     * Constructs a new ServerConnectionException with the specified detail message and cause.
     * 
     * @param message the detail message explaining the connection failure
     * @param cause the underlying cause of the exception (e.g., IOException, SocketException)
     */
    public ServerConnectionException(String message, Throwable cause) {
        super(message, cause);
        this.serverUrl = "etour.example.com";
        this.operation = "comment_modification";
        this.retryCount = 0;
        this.timeoutMillis = 5000;
    }
    
    /**
     * Gets the URL of the ETOUR server that could not be reached.
     * 
     * @return the server URL, or a default if not specified
     */
    public String getServerUrl() {
        return serverUrl;
    }
    
    /**
     * Gets the operation that was being performed when the connection failed.
     * 
     * @return the operation name, or a default if not specified
     */
    public String getOperation() {
        return operation;
    }
    
    /**
     * Gets the number of retry attempts that were made.
     * 
     * @return the retry count
     */
    public int getRetryCount() {
        return retryCount;
    }
    
    /**
     * Gets the timeout value in milliseconds that was used.
     * 
     * @return the timeout in milliseconds
     */
    public long getTimeoutMillis() {
        return timeoutMillis;
    }
    
    /**
     * Gets a user-friendly error message for display to the tourist.
     * Overrides the base implementation to provide connection-specific guidance.
     * 
     * @return a formatted error message suitable for user display
     */
    @Override
    public String getUserFriendlyMessage() {
        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
        sb.append("Server Connection Issue\n\n");
        sb.append("We're having trouble connecting to the ETOUR server.\n\n");
        
        sb.append("What happened:\n");
        sb.append("• Could not complete: ").append(operation).append("\n");
        sb.append("• Server: ").append(serverUrl).append("\n");
        
        if (retryCount > 0) {
            sb.append("• Retry attempts: ").append(retryCount).append("\n");
        }
        
        if (getCause() != null) {
            String causeMessage = getCause().getMessage();
            if (causeMessage != null && !causeMessage.isEmpty()) {
                sb.append("• Error details: ").append(causeMessage).append("\n");
            }
        }
        
        sb.append("\nWhat you can do:\n");
        sb.append("1. Check your internet connection\n");
        sb.append("2. Try again in a few moments\n");
        sb.append("3. If the problem persists, contact ETOUR support\n");
        
        return sb.toString();
    }
    
    /**
     * Gets a detailed error message for logging and debugging purposes.
     * This should be logged for system administration and troubleshooting.
     * 
     * @return a detailed error message including connection details
     */
    @Override
    public String getDetailedErrorMessage() {
        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
        sb.append("ServerConnectionException: ").append(getMessage()).append("\n");
        sb.append("Timestamp: ").append(java.time.LocalDateTime.now()).append("\n");
        sb.append("Server URL: ").append(serverUrl).append("\n");
        sb.append("Operation: ").append(operation).append("\n");
        sb.append("Retry Count: ").append(retryCount).append("\n");
        sb.append("Timeout (ms): ").append(timeoutMillis).append("\n");
        
        if (getCause() != null) {
            sb.append("Root Cause: ").append(getCause().getClass().getName()).append("\n");
            sb.append("Cause Message: ").append(getCause().getMessage()).append("\n");
            
            // Include stack trace for the root cause
            StackTraceElement[] stackTrace = getCause().getStackTrace();
            if (stackTrace != null && stackTrace.length > 0) {
                sb.append("Root Cause Stack Trace (first 5 lines):\n");
                for (int i = 0; i < Math.min(5, stackTrace.length); i++) {
                    sb.append("  at ").append(stackTrace[i]).append("\n");
                }
            }
        }
        
        sb.append("System Status: Network connectivity issue detected.");
        
        return sb.toString();
    }
    
    /**
     * Creates a specific ServerConnectionException for a connection timeout.
     * 
     * @param serverUrl the URL of the ETOUR server
     * @param operation the operation that timed out
     * @param timeoutMillis the timeout value that was exceeded
     * @param retryCount the number of retry attempts made
     * @return a ServerConnectionException for a timeout scenario
     */
    public static ServerConnectionException forTimeout(String serverUrl, String operation, 
                                                       long timeoutMillis, int retryCount) {
        return new ServerConnectionException(
            serverUrl,
            operation,
            retryCount,
            timeoutMillis,
            "Connection to ETOUR server timed out after " + timeoutMillis + "ms " +
            "while performing operation: " + operation
        );
    }
    
    /**
     * Creates a specific ServerConnectionException for a refused connection.
     * 
     * @param serverUrl the URL of the ETOUR server
     * @param operation the operation that was attempted
     * @param port the port number that was refused
     * @return a ServerConnectionException for a connection refused scenario
     */
    public static ServerConnectionException forConnectionRefused(String serverUrl, 
                                                                 String operation, int port) {
        return new ServerConnectionException(
            serverUrl,
            operation,
            0,
            5000,
            "Connection to ETOUR server was refused on port " + port + 
            " while performing operation: " + operation
        );
    }
    
    /**
     * Creates a specific ServerConnectionException for a general network error.
     * 
     * @param serverUrl the URL of the ETOUR server
     * @param operation the operation that failed
     * @param cause the underlying network exception
     * @return a ServerConnectionException for a network error scenario
     */
    public static ServerConnectionException forNetworkError(String serverUrl, 
                                                            String operation, Throwable cause) {
        ServerConnectionException exception = new ServerConnectionException(
            serverUrl,
            operation,
            3, // Default retry count
            10000, // Default 10-second timeout
            "Network error while connecting to ETOUR server during operation: " + operation
        );
        exception.initCause(cause);
        return exception;
    }
    
    /**
     * Creates a specific ServerConnectionException for server unavailability.
     * 
     * @param serverUrl the URL of the ETOUR server
     * @param operation the operation that could not be performed
     * @param httpStatus the HTTP status code received, if any
     * @return a ServerConnectionException for server unavailability
     */
    public static ServerConnectionException forServerUnavailable(String serverUrl, 
                                                                 String operation, int httpStatus) {
        String message;
        if (httpStatus > 0) {
            message = "ETOUR server returned HTTP status " + httpStatus + 
                     " while performing operation: " + operation;
        } else {
            message = "ETOUR server is unavailable or not responding during operation: " + operation;
        }
        
        return new ServerConnectionException(
            serverUrl,
            operation,
            2, // Default retry count for server errors
            30000, // Longer timeout for server issues
            message
        );
    }
    
    /**
     * Suggests whether the operation should be retried based on the error type.
     * 
     * @return true if the operation should be retried, false otherwise
     */
    public boolean shouldRetry() {
        // Retry for timeouts and temporary network errors
        // Don't retry for connection refused or permanent server errors
        String message = getMessage().toLowerCase();
        
        if (message.contains("timeout") || message.contains("network error")) {
            return retryCount < 3; // Limit retries
        }
        
        return false;
    }
    
    /**
     * Gets the suggested retry delay in milliseconds.
     * 
     * @return the suggested delay before retrying, or -1 if should not retry
     */
    public long getSuggestedRetryDelay() {
        if (!shouldRetry()) {
            return -1;
        }
        
        // Exponential backoff: 1s, 2s, 4s, etc.
        return (long) Math.pow(2, retryCount) * 1000;
    }
    
    /**
     * Creates a string representation of the exception for debugging.
     * 
     * @return string representation including connection details
     */
    @Override
    public String toString() {
        return "ServerConnectionException{" +
                "serverUrl='" + serverUrl + '\'' +
                ", operation='" + operation + '\'' +
                ", retryCount=" + retryCount +
                ", timeoutMillis=" + timeoutMillis +
                ", message='" + getMessage() + '\'' +
                '}';
    }
}

identifier for the comment\n    private String content;           // The actual comment text\n    private final String authorId;     // ID of the tourist who wrote the comment\n    private final String siteId;       // ID of the site this comment belongs to\n    private LocalDateTime createdAt;  // When the comment was originally created\n    private LocalDateTime modifiedAt; // When the comment was last modified\n    private boolean isModified;       // Flag to track if comment has been modified\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor for creating a new comment.\n     * \n     * @param id Unique identifier for the comment\n     * @param content The comment text\n     * @param authorId ID of the tourist who wrote the comment\n     * @param siteId ID of the site this comment belongs to\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if any required parameter is null or empty\n     */\n    public Comment(String id, String content, String authorId, String siteId) {\n        validateParameters(id, content, authorId, siteId);\n        \n        this.id = id;\n        this.content = content;\n        this.authorId = authorId;\n        this.siteId = siteId;\n        this.createdAt = LocalDateTime.now();\n        this.modifiedAt = this.createdAt;\n        this.isModified = false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates constructor parameters to ensure data integrity.\n     * \n     * @param id Comment ID\n     * @param content Comment content\n     * @param authorId Author ID\n     * @param siteId Site ID\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if any parameter is invalid\n     */\n    private void validateParameters(String id, String content, String authorId, String siteId) {\n        if (id == null || id.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Comment ID cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n        if (content == null || content.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Comment content cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n        if (authorId == null || authorId.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Author ID cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n        if (siteId == null || siteId.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Site ID cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Modifies the comment content with validation.\n     * This method implements the core functionality of the ModifyComment use case.\n     * \n     * @param newContent The new content for the comment\n     * @return true if modification was successful, false otherwise\n     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if new content is invalid\n     */\n    public boolean modifyContent(String newContent) {\n        // Validate the new content\n        if (newContent == null || newContent.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("New comment content cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n        \n        // Check if content is actually changing\n        if (this.content.equals(newContent)) {\n            return false; // No change needed\n        }\n        \n        // Update the content and modification metadata\n        this.content = newContent;\n        this.modifiedAt = LocalDateTime.now();\n        this.isModified = true;\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the current content of the comment.\n     * \n     * @return The comment content\n     */\n    public String getContent() {\n        return content;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the unique identifier of the comment.\n     * \n     * @return Comment ID\n     */\n    public String getId() {\n        return id;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the ID of the tourist who wrote the comment.\n     * \n     * @return Author ID\n     */\n    public String getAuthorId() {\n        return authorId;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the ID of the site this comment belongs to.\n     *      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Site description cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Adds a comment to the site.\n     * This method is called when a tourist Choose to change comment on feedback\n * 2. Verify data entered and ask for confirmation; if invalid, activate error case\n * 3. Confirm change\n * 4. Edit commentary on selected feedback\n * 5. Notify alterations\n * \n * The service also handles connection interruptions to server ETOUR.\n */\npublic class CommentModificationService {\n    private final Site site;\n    private final Tourist tourist;\n    private boolean isConnectedToServer;\n    private final Scanner scanner;\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor for CommentModificationService.\n     * \n     * @param site The site where comments are being modified\n     * @param tourist The tourist who is modifying comments\n     */\n    public CommentModificationService(Site site, Tourist tourist) {\n        if (site == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Site cannot be null");\n        }\n        if (tourist == null) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Tourist cannot be null");\n        }\n        \n        this.site = site;\n        this.tourist = tourist;\n        this.isConnectedToServer = true; // Assume connected initially\n        this.scanner = new Scanner(System.in);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main method to execute the comment modification process.\n     * This method orchestrates the entire flow of the use case.\n     * \n     * @return true if comment was successfully modified, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean executeModifyCommentFlow() {\n        System.out.println("=== Modify Comment Process ===");\n        System.out.println("Site: " + site.getName());\n        System.out.println("Tourist: " + tourist.getFullName());\n        \n        // Check connection to server ETOUR\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 1: Choose to change comment on feedback\n        Comment commentToModify = selectCommentToModify();\n        if (commentToModify == null) {\n            System.out.println("No comment selected for modification.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 2: Verify data entered and ask for confirmation\n        String newContent = getNewCommentContent();\n        if (!validateNewContent(newContent)) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Invalid comment content provided.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Ask for confirmation\n        if (!askForConfirmation(commentToModify, newContent)) {\n            System.out.println("Comment modification cancelled by user.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 3: Confirm change (implied by user confirmation)\n        // Step 4: Edit commentary on selected feedback\n        boolean modificationSuccessful = performCommentModification(commentToModify, newContent);\n        \n        // Exit: System shall notify alterations\n        if (modificationSuccessful) {\n            notifyAlterations(commentToModify);\n        }\n        \n        return modificationSuccessful;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Selects a comment to modify from the tourist\'s comments on this site.\n     * This implements Step 1 of the use case flow.\n     * \n     * @return The selected comment to modify, or null if no valid selection\n     */\n    private Comment selectCommentToModify() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 1: Select Comment to Modify ---");\n        \n        // Get all comments by this tourist on this site\n        var touristComments = site.getCommentsByTourist(tourist.getId());\n        \n        if (touristComments.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("You have no comments on this site to modify.");\n            return null;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("Your comments on this site:");\n        for (int i = 0; i < touristComments.size(); i++) {\n            Comment comment = touristComments.get(i);\n            System.out.printf("%d. [%s] %s%n", \n                i + 1, \n                comment.getCreatedAt().toString(), \n                comment.getContent().length() > 50 ? \n                    comment.getContent().substring(0, 47) + "..." : \n                    comment.getContent());\n        }\n        \n        System.out.print("\\nEnter the number of the comment you want to modify (or 0 to cancel): ");\n        \n        try {\n            int choice = Integer.parseInt(scanner.nextLine().trim());\n            \n            if (choice == 0) {\n                System.out.println("Operation cancelled.");\n                return null;\n            }\n            \n            if (choice < 1 || choice > touristComments.size()) {\n                System.out.println("Invalid selection. Please enter a number between 1 and " + touristComments.size());\n                return null;\n            }\n            \n            Comment selectedComment = touristComments.get(choice - 1);\n            System.out.println("Selected comment: " + selectedComment.getContent());\n            return selectedComment;\n            \n        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n            System.out.println("Invalid input. Please enter a valid number.");\n            return null;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets new comment content from the user.\n     * This is part of Step 2 of the use case flow.\n     * \n     * @return The new comment content entered by the user\n     */\n    private String getNewCommentContent() {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 2: Enter New Comment Content ---");\n        System.out.println("Please enter the new content for your comment:");\n        System.out.print("> ");\n        \n        return scanner.nextLine().trim();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates the new comment content.\n     * This implements the validation part of Step 2 of the use case flow.\n     * If data is invalid, the system should activate the error case.\n     * \n     * @param newContent The new comment content to validate\n     * @return true if content is valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean validateNewContent(String newContent) {\n        if (newContent == null || newContent.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Comment content cannot be empty.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (newContent.length() < 5) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Comment must be at least 5 characters long.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        if (newContent.length() > 1000) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Comment cannot exceed 1000 characters.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check for inappropriate content (basic example)\n        String[] inappropriateWords = {"spam", "advertisement", "offensive"};\n        String lowerContent = newContent.toLowerCase();\n        for (String word : inappropriateWords) {\n            if (lowerContent.contains(word)) {\n                System.out.println("Error: Comment contains inappropriate content.");\n                return false;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Asks the user for confirmation before modifying the comment.\n     * This implements the confirmation part of Step 2 of the use case flow.\n     * \n     * @param comment The comment to be modified\n     * @param newContent The new content for the comment\n     * @return true if user confirms, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean askForConfirmation(Comment comment, String newContent) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Confirm Modification ---");\n        System.out.println("Original comment: " + comment.getContent());\n        System.out.println("New comment: " + newContent);\n        System.out.println("\\nAre you sure you want to modify this comment? (yes/no)");\n        System.out.print("> ");\n        \n        String response = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n        return response.equals("yes") || response.equals("y");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Performs the actual comment modification.\n     * This implements Step 4 of the use case flow.\n     * \n     * @param comment The comment to modify\n     * @param newContent The new content for the comment\n     * @return true if modification was successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean performCommentModification(Comment comment, String newContent) {\n        System.out.println("\\n--- Step 4: Modifying Comment ---");\n        \n        // Check server connection again before modification\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection lost during modification process.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            // Check if tourist has permission to modify this comment\n            if (!tourist.canModifyComment(comment)) {\n                System.out.println("Error: You do not have permission to modify this comment.");\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            // Perform the modification\n            boolean success = comment.modifyContent(newContent);\n            \n            if (success) {\n                System.out.println("Comment successfully modified.");\n                return true;\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Comment was not modified (content unchanged).");\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {\n            System.out.println("Error during modification: " + e.getMessage());\n            return false;\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            System.out.println("Unexpected error during modification: " + e.getMessage());\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Notifies the user about the alterations made to the comment.\n     * This implements the exit condition of the use case.\n     * \n     * @param modifiedComment The comment that was modified\n     */\n    private void notifyAlterations(Comment modifiedComment) {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Notification of Alterations ===");\n        System.out.println("Your comment has been successfully updated.");\n        System.out.println("Comment ID: " + modifiedComment.getId());\n        System.out.println("Modified at: " + modifiedComment.getModifiedAt());\n        System.out.println("New content: " + modifiedComment.getContent());\n        System.out.println("====================================\\n");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks the connection to the server ETOUR.\n     * \n    /**\n     * Simulates a server connection interruption.\n     * This method can be used to test the interruption handling.\n     */\n    public void simulateServerDisconnection() {\n        this.isConnectedToServer = false;\n        System.out.println("Simulated server disconnection.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Re-establishes server connection.\n     */\n    public void reconnectToServer() {\n        this.isConnectedToServer = true;\n        System.out.println("Reconnected to server.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the current server connection status.\n     * (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Get the comment\n Where the data is invalid or insufficient, the system \n * activates the use case Errored."\n * \n * This exception is thrown when comment validation fails due to:\n * - Empty or null content\n * - Content that\'s too short or too long\n * - Content containing inappropriate words\n * - Any other validation rule violation\n */\npublic class InvalidCommentException extends ModifyCommentException {\n    \n    private final String fieldName;\n    private final String invalidValue;\n    private final String validationRule;\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructs a new InvalidCommentException with the specified detail message.\n     * \n     * @param message the detail message explaining the validation error\n     */\n    public InvalidCommentException(String message) {\n        super(message);\n        this.fieldName = "content";\n        this.invalidValue = null;\n        this.validationRule = null;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructs a new InvalidCommentException with detailed field information.\n     * \n     * @param fieldName the name of the field that failed validation\n     * @param invalidValue the invalid value that caused the failure\n     * @param validationRule the connection\n * to the ETOUR server during the comment modification process.\n */\npublic class ServerConnectionException extends ModifyCommentException {\n    \n    private final String serverUrl;\n failure\n     */\n    public ServerConnectionException(String serverUrl, String operation, \n                                     int retryCount, long timeoutMillis, String message) {\n this.retryCount = 0;\n        this.timeoutMillis = 5000; // Default 5-second timeout\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructs a new ServerConnectionException with the specified detail message and  public ServerConnectionException(String message, Throwable cause) {\n        super(message, cause);\n        this.serverUrl = "etour.example.com";\n        this.operation = "comment_modification";\n        this.retryCount = 0;\n        this.timeoutMillis = 5000;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the URL of the ETOUR server that could not be reached.\n     * \n     * @return the server URL, or a attempts that were made.\n     * \n     * @return the retry count\n     */\n    public int getRetryCount() {\n        return retryCount;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the timeout value in ").append(operation).append("\\n");\n        sb.append("• Server: ").append(serverUrl).append("\\n");\n        \n        if (retryCount > 0) {\n            sb.append("• Retry attempts: ").append(java.time.LocalDateTime.now()).append("\\n");\n        sb.append("Server URL: ").append(serverUrl).append("\\n");\n        sb.append("Operation: ").append(operation).append("\\n");\n ").append(stackTrace[i]).append("\\n");\n                }\n            }\n        }\n        \n        sb.append("System Status: Network connectivity issue detected.");\n        \n        return sb.toString();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a specific ServerConnectionException for a connection timeout.\n     * \n     * @param serverUrl the URL of the ETOUR server\n     * @param       long timeoutMillis, int retryCount) {\n        return new ServerConnectionException(\n            serverUrl,\n            operation,\n            retryCount,\n            timeoutMillis,\n                                                              String operation, int port) {\n        return new ServerConnectionException(\n            serverUrl,\n            operation,\n @param cause the underlying network exception\n     * @return a ServerConnectionException for a network error scenario\n     */\n    public static ServerConnectionException forNetworkError(String serverUrl, \n                                                            String operation, Throwable cause) {\n        ServerConnectionException exception = new ServerConnectionException(\n            serverUrl,\n            operation,\n            3, // Default retry count\n            10000, // Default 10-second timeout\n            "Network error while connecting to ETOUR server during operation: " + operation\n        );\n        exception.initCause(cause);\n        return exception;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a specific ServerConnectionException for server unavailability.\n     * \n     * @param serverUrl the URL of the ETOUR server\n     * @param operation the operation that could not be performed\n     * @param httpStatus the HTTP status code received, if any\n     * @return a ServerConnectionException for server unavailability\n     */\n    public static ServerConnectionException forServerUnavailable(String serverUrl, \n                                                                 String operation, int httpStatus) {\n        String message;\n        if (httpStatus > 0) {\n            message = "ETOUR server returned HTTP status " + httpStatus + \n                     " while performing operation: " + operation;\n        } else {\n            message = "ETOUR server is unavailable or not responding during operation: " + operation;\n        }\n        \n        return new ServerConnectionException(\n            serverUrl,\n            operation,\n            2, // Default retry count for server errors\n            30000, // Longer timeout for server issues\n            message\n        );\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Suggests whether the operation should be retried based on the error type.\n     * \n     * @return true if the operation should be retried, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean shouldRetry() {\n        // Retry for timeouts and temporary network errors\n        // Don\'t retry for connection refused or permanent server errors\n        String message = getMessage().toLowerCase();\n        \n        if (message.contains("timeout") || message.contains("network error")) {\n            return retryCount < 3; // Limit retries\n        }\n        \n        return false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the suggested retry delay in milliseconds.\n     * \n     * @return the suggested delay before retrying, or -1 if should not retry\n     */\n    public long getSuggestedRetryDelay() {\n        if (!shouldRetry()) {\n            return -1;\n        }\n        \n        // Exponential backoff: 1s, 2s, 4s, etc.\n        return (long) Math.pow(2, retryCount) * 1000;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a string representation of the exception for debugging.\n     * \n     * @return string representation including connection details\n     */\n    @Override\n    public String toString() {\n        return "ServerConnectionException{" +\n                "serverUrl=\'" +      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Site description cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Adds a comment to the site.\n     * This method is called when a tourist information in the comment\n        \n        return true;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets a comment by its ID.\n     * \n     * @param commentId The ID of the comment to retrieve\n     * @return The Comment object, or null if not found\n     */\n    public Comment getComment(String commentId) {\n        if (commentId == null || commentId.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return null;\n        }\n        return comments.get(commentId);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets all comments for this site.\n     * \n     * @return List of all comments on this site\n     */\n    public List<Comment> (Comment comment : comments.values()) {\n            if (touristId.equals(comment.getAuthorId())) {\n                touristComments.add(comment);\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return IllegalArgumentException("Comment ID cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n        \n        if (newContent == null || newContent.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            throw new IllegalArgumentException("New content cannot be null or empty");\n        }\n        \n        Comment comment = comments.get(commentId);\n        if (comment == null) {\n            return false; // site.getName());\n        System.out.println("Tourist: " + tourist.getFullName());\n        \n        // Check connection to server ETOUR\n        if (!checkServerConnection()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Connection to server ETOUR interrupted.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Step 1: Choose to change comment on feedback\n        Comment       * Displays a summary of comments after modification.\n         */\n        private void displayCommentSummary() {\n            System.out.println("\\n=== Final Comment Summary ===");\n site.");\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Your current comments on this site:");\n                for (Comment comment : touristComments) {\n                    String Modification ---");\n            testUnauthorizedModification();\n            \n            // Test 3: Server disconnection scenario\n            System.out.println("\\n--- Test 3: Server Connection testEmptyCommentContent() {\n            Comment comment = site.getCommentsByTourist(tourist.getId()).get(0);\n            System.out.println("Attempting to modify comment with empty content...");\n            \n            try {\n                // This should throw an exception\n                comment.modifyContent("");\n                System.out.println("ERROR: Should have thrown exception for empty content!");\n            } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {\n                System.out.println("✓ Correctly caught exception: " + e.getMessage());\n            }\n        }\n        \n tourist\n            Comment otherTouristComment = site.getComment("C003");\n            if (otherTouristComment != null) {\n                System.out.println("Comment by another tourist: " + otherTouristComment.getContent());\n                System.out.println("Checking if our tourist can modify it...");\n                \n                boolean canModify = tourist.canModifyComment(otherTouristComment);\n                System.out.println("Tourist can modify comment: " + canModify + \n                        " (Expected: false)");\n                \n }\n            }\n        }\n        \n        /**\n         * Tests server disconnection scenario.\n         */\n        private void testServerDisconnection() {\n            System.out.println("Current server connection status: " + \n                    (service.isConnectedToServer() ? "Connected" : "Disconnected"));\n            \n            System.out.println("Simulating server disconnection...");\n            service.simulateServerDisconnection();\n            \n            System.out.println("Attempting to modify a comment after disconnection...");\n            Comment comment = site.getCommentsByTourist(tourist.getId()).get(0);\n            \n            // This should fail due to server disconnection\n            boolean success = service.modifyComment(comment.getId(), \n                    "Test content after disconnection", false);\n            \n            System.out.println("Modification successful: " + success + \n                    " (Expected: false due to server disconnection)");\n            \n            // Reconnect for cleanup\n            System.out.println("Reconnecting to server for cleanup...");\n            service.reconnectToServer();\n        }\n        \n        /**\n         * Cleans up resources used by the application.\n         */\n        private void cleanup() {\n            System.out.println("\\n=== Application Cleanup ===");\n            \n            if (service != null) {\n                service.close();\n                System.out.println("Comment modification service closed.");\n            }\n            \n            System.out.println("\\n" + "=".repeat(50));\n            System.out.println("   APPLICATION TERMINATED SUCCESSFULLY   ");\n            System.out.println("=".repeat(50));\n            System.out.println("\\nThank you for using ETOUR Comment System!");\n        }\n    }\n}\n\nCommand Plan.finish_current_task executed:Current task is finished. This represents a security violation in the ModifyComment use case.\n * Tourists can only modify their own comments, and attempting to modify\n * someone else\'s comment should trigger this exception.\n */\npublic class UnauthorizedModificationException extends ModifyCommentException {\n    \n    private final String touristId;\n    private final String commentId;\n    private final
